This restaurant had a very unplesant odor that filled the entire place with the exception of the bathrooms. I was a guest in a group of 8, so early departure wasn't possible, but I couldn't wait to escape. In addition, the atmosphere is like a glorified Denny's and the food truly mediocre.

I've always loved CPK, not because I am a Cali girl, but its a nice joint. They do have something for everyone on their menu. Their drinks are nice, I saw the girl who was making them. She was a bit heavy handed at pouring (nice touch)! LOL! You can also get sugar free flavored teas! I have no idea why, but I never have ordered their pizza in house. It has been either take out, or the frozen ones at the store! Hahahah! Ok so today the fiance wanted to treat me out to lunch. We both ordered the BBQ chopped chicken salad. Our favorite. Since I have been cutting out certain things from my diet, I ordered it without the tortilla strips, and no avocado, with balsamic dressing on the side. The waitress was very accommodating, not flinching once.  We also got an order of the Singapore Rolls, (again due to my cutting back). The salad was terrific. We both found that it didn't need the dressing and was good the way it was. Mine came with a lime wedge so I happily squeezed away. Mine came with avocado, but oh well, I love it and thought it was a nice treat. The lunch portion was just about the right size, I ate a bit more than half and boxed the rest. The Singapore Shrimp Rolls were just a glorified Goi Cuon (Vietnamese salad rolls), though the noodles were tossed in a dressing, and it had different veggies. The slaw that came with it was pretty tasty. We liked it ok. Not as good as mine, but it is good to see people's interpretation of things. LOL! My fiance also thoroughly enjoyed his Coconut Mojito. I had a few sips, and like I said it was a nice strong drink. The staff were all friendly and nice. I'd rather go here than Azteca's, Stanford's, and Macaroni Grill. I can't say anything about the Ram, since I have never been. But overall nice experience was had again.

I first had some California Pizza Kitchen pizza on a date--it was a thai barbeque mix, or something of the sort, and it was just plain delicious.  I had never had bbq anything on a pizza before and had some reservations, but the first bite assured me this was going to be a match made in heaven, at least between the pizza and me.

I know chains are the devil in Seattle but I was glad to see a CPK here.  Reminded me of home. Had it delivered so can't speak to the actual restaurant, but the food was delicious.  A little greasier than I remembered, but delicious nonetheless.  Did seem pretty expensive for what I got, though.
their pizza is good. the crust is good i could eat it alone. tostada pizza is my favorite. the pasta dishes are pretty good.

I've been in this location a few times and it's good, but not great.  The food is good and the service is okay.  We just went there with some family and I enjoyed my veggie pizza.  We had to ask for things like more bread, a children's menu, and a few other things, but it was good overall.  It's nothing fancy or different.  I put it on the same caliber as an Applebee's, TGI Friday's, or a Chili's.  I did find out that the bread they used to bring out automatically is now only by request.  I guess they're trying to cut costs, so if you want the bread n' butter you gotta ask.
This place is overpriced. The pizza is good, but the atmosphere is lousy. I would take Pagliacci or Mad Pizza over this stuff anytime. Plus those places are way classier and taste quite a bit better.
Love their salads and pizzas. Unexpected quality for a mall restaurant.

I would give it one star but our kids like it.  I thought the pizza was gnarly (in a gross way) but the salads were fairly tasty.  Overpriced for what it is (chain chain chain).  Our waiter (and the hostess) were totally out of it - dazed and confused.  Don't know what the hype is about.  Won't get me back.
I had a pretty good pizza here, and there was a lot on the menu, but not the best.  I like the diner concept of the pizza place and the staff were friendly.
Habanero pizza, with hair in the sauce. Tasty? You judge it!  Never coming back anymore! Boycott

Well it's what you would expect from CPK. Typical mall food, huge menu, large portions, ect. Our server was exceptionally nice though so I will mention that because I find that rare at a place like this. The half portion of the salads are really big so unless you are starving or plan on taking it to go there is no need to grab a full size. They have so many options of salads, pizzas, ect you could stare at the menu for hours but you probably can't go wrong on a lot of the options.
Garlic chicken pizza, B52-coffee,spinach appetizer ,BBQ chicken salad, etc.  @CPK north gate mall, waiter is Joshua, he's so nice, handsome.

Not impressed with the service however the salad I had was great. Roasted veggie salad...DIETING!! :(  I put a lot of value on serve and this waitress was very slow and would walk away in the middle of a sentence so we had to ask twice for the rest of our order. So half the table had their order and the other half watched them eat until the rest of the food arrived.  the kids got all hopped up on sugar (hot fudge sundaes). Still full of energy at home rethinking desert next time we go to dinner. The honey chicken pizza on the kids menu is actually really good.

After a strenuous day of holiday shopping, Kim and I stumbled, starving, into California Pizza Kitchen with our many packages.  A restaurant attached to the mall was our only requirement.  (And out of the food court, as Kim has certain aversions to watching people eat fried chicken from Panda Express within 2 feet of her.  Me?  No problem eating in a food court.) I was pleasantly surprised at the menu -- pizza (duh), pastas of all kinds, fresh salads, and a variety of appetizers including egg rolls, tuscan hummus, and crab cakes.  Although several of the cheesy pastas being inhaled around me were calling my name, I went with my gut and chose the Waldorf Salad, which is my favorite kind of salad -- sweet dressing, with nuts, apples, grapes, crumbled cheese, and chicken.   This salad was exactly what I needed, because as the weather gets colder, I seem to eat take-out much more than I should!  :)  Our wonderful, lovely server in the bar recommended the "Regular" portion ($2 less) because the large was evidently HUUUGE, and my "regular" size was more than enough to fill me up! Kim got the hummus (too garlic-y and tangy for my taste) with warm, soft delicious pita triangles, of which I ate many.   All in all, it ended one of my favorite kind of days -- a great meal and productive shopping trip!  And the ONLY thing I bought for myself was a wallet and this salad, huzzah!!!

As far as chain restaurants go, I feel that CPK is pretty good.  When I was studying abroad in China, the second we got to Shanghai, we headed to CPK because we needed something besides that Chinese food in Beijing.  Good times...anyway! Reviewing the Northgate location. The hummus plate is a great appetizer.  A good portion, perfect for sharing and healthy. For main courses, I've had the kung pao spaghetti, the greek pizza with avocado and the mushroom and goat cheese pizza. Ever since I've had the greek pizza, I never order anything else.  This is like a fresh greek salad on bread. Love it. The honey wheat crust is also excellent (maybe not on the greek pizza).  I would probably skip the kung pao spaghetti. Its been a while since I last went, but writing this review has made me want to go again!

I already filed a complaint through their national office, so this will be brief and to the point: Restaurant closes at 10p, I asked if they were still serving at 9:50p and was seated. Party of 2. - 9:51p Waitress #1 immediately appears announcing the kitchen was closing and we needed to order, I order drinks but ask for at least a minute to decide - 9:53p Waiter #2 delivers wrong drink order, but takes entre order, promising to get correct drunk order. We order 2 full pizzas and a salad. They never did correct the drink order. - No bread brought to the table (forgot about this until their national Web page asked if the free bread was brought as it should be). - 10:05p waitress #1 brings salad and pizzas together, announcing that restaurant is closing.  I get it:  everyone wants to go home.  you don't really want us here... despite the fact you seated us. But salads are traditionally appetizers and brought before the meal. thanks for trying to speed us along by bringing it all at once, but... never mind. Sent back the salad since it wasn't brought first. - 10:10p busboy begins bussing table next to us, bringing his fully loaded tray of used dishes while the couple next to us WERE STILL EATING. I get ready to yell at busboy if he should do the same to me. Busboy appears to notice the look on my face and goes back inside. - 10:12p Waitress #1, to her credit does ask if the *food* is okay. - No further checks on us; waitress #1 and Waiter #2 ignore us, despite cashing out couple sitting next to us. I have to call waitress #1 as she walks past us to ask her for refills on our empty glasses. - Waitress #1 lets me know they have "dumped all the lemonade because they're closed" (!?) so no refills are available. I asked for the general manager... who appeared offended that I bothered him and was complaining.  His only response was that they close at 10 and, the restaurant was now closed. Oh... but he took the $2 lemonade off the bill. We packed up the food and left by 10:20p.  Sorry I kept them late. Not going back. I spend my $$$ at restaurants who appear happy that I'm there and interested in giving me a place to relax.

Service was very poor. The boyfriend and I only ended up ordering a beer. The server that was waiting on us never even bothered checking up on us and seeing if we wanted food or not, despite the place being practically empty. And all the cooks were sitting around at one booth doing nothing. Don't know if it was their break time or what, but pretty sure they shouldn't all be on break at the same time. Not much of a menu either. I definitely won't be coming back to this CPK anytime soon.

Better than average mall food. I had the pesto sauce penne, which as decent. However, in a city the size of Seattle, you've got to do better than decent when it comes to pasta as there are so many places out there that do superb food. I would like to compliment my server, Michael. It was dinner time when I went in and that place was BUSY. My server never missed a beat and was on top of it the entire time while never seeming rushed. As a former bartender, I know how hard that is to pull off.

Upon glancing at the other reviews it is completely mixed. I do respect that because everyone's experience is different. Mine however has always been up to par. I've never had any service issues or food issues. I've been many many times and found the wait staff to be pleasant and accommodating. There are occasions when things get busy and it might take them a bit longer to get back to you but they are normally on point and they aren't bothersome.  I've had the entire variety of spring rolls which are my faves as far as appetizers go, my husband normally get's the Chipotle pizza whereas I'm more diverse. I have sampled numerous items on the menu and have yet to be disappointed. The salads are delish and large in portions...event the half salads are decent sizes and filling. The Chinese chicken salad is so good! They also have a new entree featuring the cedar plank salmon with corn succotash and I thought it was to die for. Personally it had the right amount of spice, it was cooked perfectly, and the fish was just delicious. I couldn't stop talking about it after I left. $18 for that dish and I thought it was worth it.  I also like the fact that they have a separate booklet that helps you compare nutrition facts and calories for those who are dieting. Because I don't get the pizza, I can say I haven't had any issues with greasiness or oily foods. Everything seems so fresh and tastes good. For such a large menu I commend that cooking brigade for getting all those dishes out. Keep up the good work and keep it clean!!!

I know California Pizza Kitchen isn't really in the realm of what most would consider capable of being five stars, but frankly, I consider this location to be best represented with the description of TGI Friday's on Ecstasy. I honestly don't even go here for pizza or entrees of any kind - it is purely a Fru Fru Cocktail and comfort food appetizers haven in my book, and for that, I adore it.   My favorite drinks - All of the Margaritas, all of the Muh Jeye Toes, and the effin' mudslide.  Whoever decided to make a chocolate milk shake that gets you drunk is both a genius and a moron, and I love to hate him/her.  If it weren't for the 500 calories per cup, I'd probably just hook up a mudslide IV while I'm at work.   Bitesss -  "Hey... some customers are complaining that our food isn't unhealthy enough." "Maybe we should add macaroni and cheese to the menu..." "Yeah but some might not realize that pasta and sauce isn't automatically unhealthy..." "What if we add twice AS MUCH sauce... " "That could work, but there's gotta be a way to take that next step..." "Oh... sh*t!  We'll deep fry it!" "It's so obvious." Crispy Mac n Cheese - Duh.  Avocado Egg Rolls - Duh.  Dynaymite Shrimp - You know where I'm going with this.... I don't need to get into it, just like I don't need to be able to fit through the door when I leave.   Indulge yourself.

A good place to get dinner at the mall. In fact, my new favorite place if I want to pair it with some shopping or a salon visit. Not complicated or fancy, but I like the vibe way better than other chain mall restaurants. Their Moroccan chicken salad has a bunch of good ingredients. Their pizzas are good, I've had mushroom and enjoyed it. I like that they do half-size wine pours. The server we had last time went out of his way to greet us and make us feel welcome, and I had a very friendly server the last time. Note: You can get $5 off if you sign up for their e-club. I'm always looking for a good deal, and I thought this would be cheaper but after a half chicken salad, wine, tax/tip, my bill ran up to $18, so I would forgo the drink next time to save monies.

Food was good, service not so good. Perhaps they where short staffed but either way I wouldn't go back to this location. I've been to the one in Bellevue for my friends bday about a month ago and it was great. We where with a large group then (about 8 ppl) and we left happy, so my coworkers decided to come to the one here in Northgate for my birthday and another girls   Bday and there was about 9 or so of us. In Bellevue CPK my friend got a free bday dessert, but not here at Northgate. The waiter was super busy and it was hard to get a min with him, 2 girls tried to tell him about the bdays in the group but no luck, he walked off to quickly. We ordered the Moroccan chicken salad (one of my favs) as well as another salad and two pizzas. The food was good but being that was familiar with Moroccan salad I noticed it was missing two main ingredients: squash and beets. When we brought it to the waiters attention he said he would check on it, turns out the restaurant was out of both items. He removed the salad from our bill and gave us a second salad of the one we ordered at no charge but it didn't come out until it was time to leave (we told the waiter we only had one hour and we where there for lunch) he boxed it for us. We asked the waiter for water for some of late arrivers but it never came. We also asked for more silver wear and it never came (she ended up eating her salad with a salad spoon). We realized 10 min into the meal we needed another pizza but we couldn't get it order because the waiter didn't come by in time to put the order in. The ice teas never where refilled and I left hungry. We let the manger know and he apologized but honestly it shouldn't get to that point when you go out to eat. Hopefully the bad service was a fluke but I'm not  going back to that CPK location to find out.

I had enough points on my American Express card to get a $25 gift card to this place so at least I did not spend my own money. Used it to purchase 2 bland pizzas that were very small for a $12 pizzas.  Workers looked at me like I was there to detonate a suicide vest  when I walked in with my gym bag since I was taking a bus home. This chain is a scam. I guess if you hear enough people say a chain is so wonderful  and so great someone will believe it. Their pizza is only a little bit better than Little Caesars but a lot smaller and a lot  more costly. I would never go here again. Horrible value and really small pizzas along with  a bizarre entree selection.

I come in regularly - sometimes alone, sometimes w/ my husband.  I love the staff - they are very good (waitpeople) and the food is pretty good.  Normally, I'd leave 5 stars for those two reasons, but today, they get bumped down to 2.  My waitress, Madison, was wonderful - attentive and friendly and fast.  However, I came in early - 11:15am and only two other people were there at the counter.  The music was very loud - I think they turn it up when they are setting up the restaurant.  This is superbowl Sunday - the game is set to begin at 3pm and the TV's were on, but weren't playing through the speakers.  I asked Madison to turn down the music just a little bit and she consented.  About 3 minutes later, the sound switched to the TV and got incredibly loud.  So loud that the words distorted.  I looked up and over at the food prep area (which is open for everyone to see) and the entire cook staff and manager, Carl, were staring at me.  It was very odd and seemed to be a FU to me.  I can't understand why - they know me there and I am always very polite and tip well so there was no reason for hostility.  And, it wasn't an accident since they were just staring at me.  The TV was broadcasting some inane interview with foreign reporters about what they thought about the upcoming game - so it wasn't even that interesting or relevant.  After about 2 minutes, Carl turned down the TV to the original, still-too-loud volume, and I guess the message was that I should be thankful for that volume because of what it could have been.  I doubt he would have done that if there were other customers besides me at a booth eating and two guys at the counter drinking.  The waitress came back and apologized and said that the manager really wanted to hear the game.  What game?  There was no game playing and we were 4 hours before it.  About 15 minutes later, a couple was seated at the booth behind me.  Madison waited on them too and they could not hear her.  She kept raising her voice and still the man couldn't understand what she was telling him about this menu options.  It was ridiculous.  Maybe Carl was in a bad mood because he had to work today - whatever his reason, his behavior was very unprofessional and immature and everyone that works there recognized that.

Yes, this place is a chain. But I worked at the mall for about a year and a half, and if I wanted to get food after work at someplace a bit nicer than the food court or Chipotle, this was one of the better options. I would not recommend it for PIZZA pizza (tomato sauce, cheese, pepperoni, GREASE) but they do have a lot of interesting specialty pizzas. The menu is quite large and diverse. It does kind of have that overall blandness that I've come to associate with chain restaurants -- while everything I've tried is good, nothing was particularly exciting or unexpected. Actually, that's not true -- they have pizzas with salad ON THEM. That's pretty unusual, unless it's a California thing; I wouldn't know. I haven't tried one because they just sound weird. The personal pizza is usually a bit too big for me to eat in one sitting, but leftovers are nice. It's worth getting a box for your leftovers instead of stuffing yourself here, because they have good desserts. Key Lime Piiiieeeee.... The drinks are also good. I love love love their dessert coffee drink Almond Joy, which includes amaretto, coconut rum and chocolate syrup. Yummmm. Here's the thing that always bothers me about this place, though. They have a very strange service policy, that apparently is enforced by corporate, that I don't like. Servers all introduce themselves in their flat, scripted way ("Hi! I'm John and I'll be serving you tonight! Can I tell you about our specials?") and every time I've eaten there, the manager on duty has come around at least once during the meal and asked us how we are doing. This might seem like a nice touch, but it feels very corporate-enforced. I've had two separate managers do this, a man and a woman, and both of them seemed almost suspicious of their servers. "Is everything okay? Reeeally?" It was a weird attitude to have, because we were doing just fine, and it made me feel like there was something weird going on except that this seems to happen every time (I've asked some co-workers if they had that happen too, and they all did.) So, Corporate, if you're reading this, STOP MAKING THEM DO IT! It's really annoying and weird. The food and drinks are quite good, but the most this place will get is four stars (really 3.5) because of the weird service issues.

I have been to this particular location a few times, but I have been to CPK's all over, and always have a similar experience. The service is good, and the food is good. Yes, they are somewhat overpriced. Which is probably part of the reason I don't go here that often.  BUT, they have good pizza. And in the end, that is all that really matters. I LOVE their honey wheat crust. It is especially good with the chicken club pizza, which has bacon, avocado, tomatoes, and lettuce and mayo. It sounds weird, but is actually delicious! I am also a huge fan of their thin crust Sicilian pizza. Oddly enough, their signature bbq chicken pizza isn't that great.  I think the only bad experience I ever had here is that I ordered an iced tea, and I took a drink and it tasted awful. So I told my waitress that it tasted funny, she instead brought me a diet coke, and in a few minutes came back to let me know that it turns out someone had accidentally made iced coffee instead of iced tea. The fact that she looked into it, and fixed the problem was really awesome.  The wait can be kind of long on the weekends, but it has a pretty odd location at North Gate, so sadly it doesn't get as much business as it should.  Surprisingly, their frozen pizzas are really good too.
Wait staff is always super friendly.  Ask if they have any specials.  Waiter told me the menu is changing and the Greek pizza is going away! Get it before it's gone.

I have been to California Pizza Kitchen a couple of times.I really enjoyed it at both locations Bellevue and Northgate. The food is great and the service is excellent. The staff is prompt, accurate and very  friendly. The menu selection is great. It's innovative with alot of variety. I have had their pizza, pasta and appetizers. I highly recommend the works pizza, the spinach artichoke dip, the quesadilla small plate and the tequila fetucchini. Both locations had a great environment and overall atmosphere. The experience has been great both times.

"Really?!" My first thought when my server brought me my $5.79 chicken quesadilla. This so-called "small plate" was actually the tiniest quesadilla I've ever seen. It would have been cute if I weren't ravenous and pissed off about paying nearly 6 bucks for a "meal" that I ate in 4 bites, literally. The flavor was good but for the price it was a joke. C'mon CPK, don't do me like dat!
I use to go to this place all the time for lunch but am very sad they took my favorite cheese revoli away. The food is just not cooked the same way. Sad I won't be going here much.

The wait staff was out of sync with our table tonight.  They made a mistake with our order.  We had to ask a couple of times to get bread.  The man from the kitchen delivering the food slammed the plates on our table. The salad was a soggy pile of wilted greens not what we are accustomed to get.  I hope we don't get sick.  I am really not satisfied with the treatment we got at this location tonight.

It's hard for me to decide how many stars to give. My most recent visit went from hugely disappointing to remarkable in the span of 10 minutes. Let me explain. I get the Thai chicken pizza nearly every time, and nearly every time it's great. Except once. After placing my order and waxing effusive to my friend about how incredible the Thai chicken pizzas are, the waiter dropped off a dry, sad looking, flat, flimsy pie absent of adequate sauce or toppings. My reaction was mildly visceral. I took one bite. To be fair, it tasted marginally better than it looked. But it was not nearly as good as I remembered. A 3 out of 10 at best. Now I hardly ever send food back. Let's just say I'm paranoid about disgruntled kitchen crews adding foreign "toppings" to my order. But today, a CPK District Manager happened to be making the rounds, asking how everyone's food was. When she approached our table, I told her my dish was "OK, but it used to be really good in the past." She apologized and said: "Let me take care of that for you," and whisked the sorry thing away. About 10 minutes later she returned, apologizing again for the wait. And what she placed in front of me was nothing short of legendary. The crust was perfect. The sauce was perfect. The toppings were piled comically high. It looked almost too good to eat. But I ate it. And it was the one of the best pizzas I've ever had.  Now she didn't say so, but I think the DM made my pizza that day. But whoever made it got it right. I only wish every CPK zaw was that amazing.

Depressing. As soon as yo walk in you get  a slap in the face of '"dirty bleach towel"' stench. Greasy, brown stinky bleach water mindlessly smeared over every surface with a similarly soiled bar towel. As if the bleach bucket was some magical potion that no mater how vile the object, it would be miraculously cleansed. Baptized at the font of sanitation. You get used to it eventually. This is anti-food! It Was food. It must have been food at some point! Just because this model of a restaurant is everywhere doesn't mean it should be! If you don't have any other options in your area then it is a different story, but in Seattle, these types of "restaurants" don't need to exist.  And it's expensive!

One of my favorite chain restaurants. Food - As expected - good Staff - Very nice and extremely friendly So why the 2 star review? Placed an online order over 1 hour in advance for pickup - 5 minutes before pulling into the CPK parking lot got a call from them that one of the items I ordered (avocado egg rolls) was out. This was my whole reason for choosing CPK! The replacement option was fine and so was the pizza - but I really was craving the egg rolls. And they were out of bread.

location: South Jordan, Salt Lake City, UT
review: It's been years since I've gone to CPK and I think I know why...I wasn't that impressed this time around. The host was very nice and service was excellent, but the food wasn't too good.  The bf ordered the infamous BBQ chicken pizza but honestly, we both preferred buying and eating the frozen CPK brand versions at Safeway (for less than half the price!). The size is exactly the same as the frozen version and taste pretty much the same.  I love cajun food and perhaps CPK isn't the place to order that but I thought I'd give the jambalaya fettuccine a try. It was decent but not nearly as delicious as the cajun jambalaya pasta from the Cheesecake Factory (Oh my, that pasta is amazing!!).  Overall, it was mediocre and a bit pricey for the amount and quality of food.

Disappointed by this location! First we ordered curbside takeaway. They weren't busy at all but it took them 5+ mins to even notice us waiting outside. No bread or utensils when I requested for them. No bacon on my pizza when I paid extra for it. After spending almost $100 and driving 30+ mins I'm sadly disappointed.

LOVE CPK!!!!!!  My husband and I get the same thing almost every time we come and we just split everything: - Fried mac and cheese appetizer - omg good - BBQ chicken pizza - SO GOOD! - Four cheese ravioli - amazing This location is great too.  While the parking sucks, you can still find parking, just have to walk a bit usually.  I've always had great service here, and had especially amazing service last night.  Great place!

My friend and I decided that we needed a bit of nostalgia in our lives so we came here for dinner on a Sunday evening. The Bellevue location used to be our hangout spot in high school so we decided to go back and reminisce.  Even though it's great to know that this place has updated its menu, I was bummed that they didn't have the Thai chicken pasta anymore. So I opted for an Italian chopped salad instead. There wasn't enough dressing, not enough meat, and the "large" portion still wasn't that big.  However, we did see the mayor of Seattle here which was pretty cool. My friend didn't believe that it was him until I showed her a Youtube video of him...and then she believed me.  Anyway, this place is just meh. I'm sure the pizza is still decent...I'd go for that the next time I need some high school flashbacks.

Never been to a CPK. The wild mushroom pizza was delicious as was the champagne vinaigrette on the house greens. I have made a lot of strawberry shortcakes in my life but none as good as the one we had tonight.  The manager Adam was outstanding. He learned it was our first visit and treated us like royalty. We were expecting a run of the mill mall restaurant but the great food and exceptional service from Adam and his staff made it a fantastic evening. Thanks to all of you at CPK in Northgate for a great dining experience. Can't wait to come back.
Great service with variety of food choices - even for the diabetic recipes to choose from.  Dan K.

We occasionally have this delivered to the office for catered lunch... I would rather eat ANYTHING else!! Need a reason not to like CPK? Check out their health inspection scores... improper cold storage, not having proper hand washing stations in place, no barriers between bare hands and ready to eat foods... YUCK
It's a CPK. Good tasting pizza. Decent prices. The staff was friendly and the food was really good.  Tried the dessert this time too and it was really good. Highly recommended! JR

Have had this several times before, and it were always good ! I also tried to order to-go, and they offered me their french bread appetizer, which was very interesting (I took the offer haha).  Also, try their tiramisu cake for desert, I had it once and now I'm craving for it everyday!

I came in tonight and ordered the shrimp lettuce wraps. They were delicious and arrived very quickly. My server was Alicia and she was very lovely and informative. My friend had some questions about certain items and she knew everything! We both ordered the mahi mahi tacos and they were  . Totally recommend to everyone! It was a tad busy but Alicia took care of us and everyone around us! We will be back soon!

I am from Texas and I love California Pizza Kitchen. I have been traveling for 9 months and a lot up the state's I was in didn't have one.  I'm also very financially challenged so I can't afford it right now. But I heard about their reward program and that you get a free small plate. I drove 20 miles of course in the rain to get my sausage flat bread which is usually sooo delicious.  But not today.  Today I waited20 to 25 minutes for a ice cold flat bread with maybe3 sausage on it.  I know what the normal flat bread tastes like so when I'm back in Texas and making money again I will be back. But I would not be back to this one if I lived here.  Grant it was free but as someone who 20 years ago waited tables ALL the food should come out of the kitchen the same free or $500 a plate.   I'm feeling bummed for not get a sausage flat bread fix

We normally dont have anything bad to say about CPK & i like going there because i KNOW what to expect and I KNOW what im getting. Tonight i was incredibly disappointed!!  The flatbread was gross and soggy.  It was DRENCHED IN WET SPINACH. Globs of spinach inundated the flat bread.  The kungpao spaghetti was bland. ALL YOU TASTED was chili peppers & Garlic. No flavor n hardly any sauce whatsoever!! The tequila chicken pasta was okay. NOT ANYWHERE as tasty as it normally is but it was not awful.  When i called to ask if they had a new chef i was told by Carl (the shift manager) that he would talk to them, but they dont have any new food preparation staff!!  He didnt take the opportunity to earn my confidence back or offer to replace those items! TO ADD INSULT TO INJURY; I TIPPED THE THE TAKE OUT PERSON 20%!!!!  This is what i get?!?!  SHAME ON YOU CPK FOR NOT TRYING TO REMEDY THIS SITUATION OR FOR TRYING TO GAIN MY BUSINESS & CONFIDENCE BACK. Regrettably I will take my business elsewhere. BUCA DI PEPPO will enjoy my business even MORE withou CPK in my rotation!

We went on Saturday night, were seated quickly, greated by an extremely friendly waitress.  Ordered pretty quick and got our food ASAP.  It was really great service.  My only small little complaint was my pizza crust was a little burnt.  It will still good however, warm and very very fresh.  She also re-filled our drinks religiously!  This was our second time - the first time, the manager gave us a free appetizer for being new.  The first time our waiter had a little bit dry sense of humor - made some interesting comments but the manager made up for that.   We'll be back for quick and easy pizza night.

I came here while I was visiting Seattle and I really enjoyed this place! I ordered the shrimp and mushroom cream penne and it was really delicious! To spice up my meal, I also ordered a raspberry mojito which was absolutely delicious! The waitress was really nice!

Growing up in Hawaii, you know you love California Pizza Kitchen. As far as restaurant chains go, CPK is second to none. Their service is always great, food is consistent regardless of location, and menu changes occur seasonally to keep things fresh. This Northgate location is no different. Second year GM Eric C. Moffitt has gone great lengths to raise standards in regards to service, store presentation, and general guest satisfaction. Always taking good care of regulars, he gives first time guests the same hospitable treatment. If you're near a CPK, give it a shot. I can't speak for all the stores in the company, but the ones in Hawaii and this particular one on Seattle get six stars out of five from me. Ask for Mike A. or Chris to be your server. You wont be disappointed.

I only give it a 2 star because of the service.  The food is great once it was right.  We placed a take out order and first the waitress mistaken my pizza for a salad but fixed it no problems. I get back to the hotel ready to feed my children only to see the main toppings are not even on my pizza or in my bag. I call and the Manger argued w me about everything. Long story short is if you order take out make sure everything is right before you go unless you want the Manger to say you are basically stupid.

Walked into Cpk and sat for 15 minutes and  a waiter  still didn't come and help me. I finally got up and asked the greeter for some help. She took my order. I found it odd that it took them so long to help me. The greeter was a life saver for the server. She actually took my order and got my drink for me. Having said that as usual the food was great I always have the Thai crunch salad and a lemonade.

I've been to this CPK about two or three times. Yes CPK is a chain. So don't expect this location to have any better food than any of the other CPK's out there. However, CPK does have some delicious pizza. For some reason I'm a big fan of their Rosemary chicken and potato pizza (yeah I know potato on a pizza?!?) and their BLT Pizza (or is it a california club?) anyway regardless CPK has good service, yummy pizza, and all at reasonable prices. Getting a table at this location has also never been an issue. So that's good.  ~G

I went here with my family last night, and lets just say, I've had better, even from here...which is why I'm giving it 3 stars and not 2 because I am very well aware of what kind of service this place is capable of. First we had a party of 7, there were plenty of booths that were open up against the wall where some of us could sit in a booth and some in a chair, but we got seated in a booth right next to the kitchen (which had a very peculiar and suspicious smell) and they pulled up an extra chair so someone was right in the line of fire.  Our waitress was gone for, pretty much the entire time. We needed refills on drinks, more napkins for the kids, and there was no one to ask because we were stuck in this little corner the entire time. At one point we even had to get up and go find someone to get the kids dessert because they were getting a little ancy waiting for it.  Regardless of the service the food was still good. Chicken Piccata and the original chopped salad with gorgonzola. The salad probably being my favorite, delicious! I'm sure I'll be back here in the future, I'm not just in too much of a hurry...

Not only was our food delicious, our server was A+. It's a little irritating when waiters give you the same ol' spiel about trying their new dishes, but Chris was fantastic. He was quick, he was friendly but not too friendly, and also reminded me of a real life Santino impersonating Tim Gunn going on a date with Andrae to Red Lobster. I'd come back just for Chris.
Beer  is 6.29 too pricey salad had chunks of bacon too big server brought bill without asking if we wanted anything else.  We did!

Not super thrilled with the service. Our waitress didn't seem too bright. Watching her attempt to make my friend's Smith and Wesson was akin to watching Spongebob and Patrick figure a quantum physics problem on a blackboard. She didn't have a clue, but dagnabbit, she was gonna try. I ordered the bianci flatbread, and my friend ordered the BBQ pizza. The food was excellent, the flatbread was heavy on Gorgonzola and truffle, which was fine with me! I tried the pizza and was awestruck by how light and squishy the crust was. Squishy with the perfect amount of crunch. I have to say that the service improved as we stayed longer. I will definitely be back.

Had dinner here last night. Fabulous server provided excellent service throughout the entire dining experience.  So expensive for what you get. My husband had a pizza - good (thin) crust and okay toppings. My son had the kids pepperoni pizza - standard stuff.  I ordered the Thai pasta with chicken. For $13 it better be a dang good pasta dish. Hardly 3 bites of chicken in the entire dish. Noodles were barely warm - and were cold halfway through finishing the dish. Not spicy enough my taste - but probably fine for a mass service restaurant.  Looked at the dessert menu but the prices were outrageous. $7 for a slice of cake - plus another $1.50 for a scoop of ice cream. Too many other dessert options nearby.  Overall it was not a bad experience. But $50 for two adults and a child with no appetizer, dessert or alcohol was just too much. If food was outstanding or price was lower I would give more stars.

I'd been here once way back in high school, but didn't remember what it was like.  I visited again last week with the same people I'd been with when I went in high school - apparently they go all the time. Overall I wasn't super impressed.  Our waitress was rather snooty and forgetful (we had to ask her twice to bring us some bread) and they were out of gorganzola cheese (how is that possible?), thus making it impossible for my friends to get their regular pizza. My Wild Mushroom pizza was pretty good, though they were not very generous with the sauce.  It made for some tasty leftovers though and I was generally satisfied with my order. The prices seem sort of insane to me, especially for pizza and pasta served from a location in a mall. The salads look pretty good, so I would likely come here again...but it definitely wouldn't be my first choice.

California Pizza Kitchen does a pretty good job with their pizza (fortunately since that's part of their name) and is better than many of the pizza chains around. This CPK is located at the margin of Northgate mall and thus has abundant, but annoying, parking. The interior is minimalistic, but the booths are comfortable and a few TVs at the bar offer the promise of distraction. As an appetizer, we chose the chips and guacamole dip. They have an interesting concoction by using corn in their dip. Surprisingly, this works fairly well with the chips and was a pleasant discovery.  For the main course, I went with the Buffalo chicken. This was well done with just enough spice to be entertaining compounded by celery and ranch dressing.  Service was also prompt with frequent water and coffee refills. Overall it makes a pretty good choice for a quick meal around the mall.

Sometimes you just need the salty cheesy carb-bomb that is the thai pizza at California Pizza Kitchen, or as my family inexplicably calls it "California Pizza Chicken." While their frozen sicilian pizza is in my opinion the only frozen pizza worth buying, the frozen version of their thai pizza is just gross in comparison to the one you get in the restaurant. I've never had a problem with the service at the Northgate location but then again it's a CPK it's not like I'm expecting the world. :) The waiter was friendly and personable, though I did have on nit to pick. My fiancee ordered the wedge salad, I ordered the half roasted vegetable salad and we ordered the Thai pizza. For some reason only his salad came before the pizza despite the fact that I was the one who actually put in the pizza order. Fortunately the pizza was screaming hot so I wasn't forced to deciding between hot pizza and my salad. One thing I love about CPK is their salads. They definitely aren't really for those people watching their diets, a full size salad with chicken will usually clock in at about 1000 calories but they are super delicious. I think their salads, and more specifically the avocado, would be the reason that their prices are high for what they offer. In Washington I've only been to the Bellevue, Tukwila, and Northgate locations but they without fail always have perfectly ripe, bright green avocado and it doesn't taste like it was soaked in preservatives or lime. They must throw out 2 avocados for every 1 that they use or else they have some kind of food science sorcery that lets them preserve the avocado without making it taste like they did. If you work near a CPK and don't mind the prices they offer great to-go service. You have the choice to order online or by phone and either walk-in or at some locations they have car-side service where they just bring it out to your car. When I went to pick up my food from the Tukwila location they always offered me a drink while I waited if I showed up before the specified time.

Sad thing is I like the food but after the lousy service tonight I won't be back. 30 - 45 minutes for the kid to get a cup of hot coco and for the wife to get a cafe mocha was insane. Funny how as the manager was talking to us as we were getting up to leave suddenly the drinks pop up. To late jack, Starbucks and a burger from a fast food joint combined was faster. I wish I could say they were slammin busy but alas there were only 8 tables being used a drunk dude at the bar.

I like California Pizza Kitchens food  and very good quality of it. I like their peperoni pizza and pasta alfredo. But the only bad is they are so expensive and that's why I don't dine there that often. They are too much money and outrageous prices too. But very service thoe. Heidi

I love CPK! Things I love: Spinach Artichoke Dip which are served with chips, Garlic Cream Fettucine with Shrimp and Mushrooms, BBQ Chicken Salad, and the Pulled Pork Pizza served with Habanero Sauce. Soooo delicious!! :) I always tend to go to CPK with my girlfriends for lunch because we rarely have to wait to eat and the food is excellent. The reason why I docked one star was because they changed their table bread. It used to be really yummy and now it's just bleh. Other than that, everything is great!

So the first time I ever stepped into a CPK, I always knew they had great pizza. But I'm not such a pizza person. I visited with my friend, since I live in walking distance from the mall, and it wasn't busy at all. We went during the afternoon, and got seated right away. I presented a free small cravings coupon that I obtained through the bite of Seattle. I ordered the hummus plate, and it was real good. The first time I tried the hummus, was at the bite of Seattle. So good job on the marketing there! Then going on to the main event, I always order and swear by this dish: Portobello mushroom ravioli with cream sauce. The serving may not look so big, but I can never finish it. The ravioli is big enough to half it and take bites from there. Service wise, seems like they know their stuff and good customer service. As we were leaving we were handed these special coupons that we had to go back and dine to redeem. Once again good idea! I'm probably going this week or next!

Solid. Decent service.   Food was quick. Pizza was predictably tasty - although, hard to go wrong with pizza... "Special dishes" not as predictable. Peeps, it's called CPK.  Stick to the pizza, and it'll be *** all good ***
Tried their new Dark and Red drink and loved it!!!! Also Amy tried the Appleberry and likes it!!! Good place and great food
A bit drab and dimly lit.  Salad was very good but pizza was heavy.  Disappointing after a great experience in Austin TX CPK.

Good food, they do a great job of making their food flavorful without adding a lot of fat.  However, I feel it is expensive for the portion sizes.  The grilled vegetable salad was delicious but very skimpy on the actual vegetables, and filled out with tons of romaine lettuce.  Asparagus soup was a huge winner, creamy and flavorful.   Server was nice, but he only came by to take orders, drop off food, and then drop off the check.  No offers of a drink refill or asking if we needed anything.

This is my least favorite cpk location.  To start, I had the most boring server in the restaurant. He did not have the personality of other servers in the restaurant which makes interactions quite difficult. He was also a bit slow. When i asked for a refill it took about 3 minutes(it was kind of slow at the time of us sitting down)  The location is very spacious and clean. It has plenty of seating and during lunch time their was no wait which is always great.  The food was great like usual. I always start out with the dumplings that are always mmmmmm mmm good with the Hawaiian pizza. I am a once every 2 month regular at cpk.

We love the California pizza kitchen in Bellevue, and recently were in Northgate mall and when it was time for lunch we didn't even consider any other choice.  We came in for a late lunch, were seated quickly. We ordered Sesame ginger chicken dumplings and a Spicy chipotle chicken pizza on a thin crust. We had not tried the dumplings before and enjoyed it a lot. The pizza is a favoriite and it never disappoints. The friendly quick service and good food made for a great lunch.

I've always loved CPK  I'm not a huge fan of Franchise restaurants but this one is definitely an exception!  We stopped for lunch with our son who wanted pizza! We were in the neighborhood for an allergy appointment so why not haven't been in a few years!  My husband ordered the buffalo cauliflower, the boys had pizza and I had the split pea soup and pot stickers. My hubby loved the cauliflower. And for him that's a big deal since he's not a huge vegetable eater! He ate the whole thing!  My lunch was so good. The split pea has always been delicious and is consistent. The pot stickers were so good! The sauce on top was delicious and just the right amount! Our server and her twin sister were awesome! Very attentive and friendly! Glad we revisited CPK after all this time!

TLDR: serves more than pizza. Very filling.  Dining area has a lot of booths and feels almost like a buffet. Average noise level. I'm pretty impressed with the variety in their menu. There are a lot of Asian style foods along with the typical pizzas. There are apps, small plates, and entrees--not just pizza! I honestly had a hard time not ordering everything I saw.  Service: wait to be seated, order at the table, check brought to table, your table will be bused. Complimentary bread and oil dip: bread is crunchy on the outside and chewy inside. Just how I like it. Oil dip is not very salty but is lightly herby. Smashed Chicken Meatball Piadina: Chicken is very tender and I'm a fan of that crushed tomato--tastes very fresh! Salty and tangy flavors blend nicely. Since it comes with soup I recommend you get the half size at lunch hour--a full size is way too filling especially with the soup! Baked Potato Soup: delightfully chunky and melt in your mouth consistency. Has a slight tang to it and is not too salty. Be warned--it's super filling! Sparkling Cranberry Cooler: a bit on sour side but refreshing nonetheless. Not as "sparkling" as I though it would be--low carbonation.

We got a giftcard to this place so why not come for a mostly free meal? We ordered a pizza and a salad.  Both were very mediocre. Pizza crust was not crispy or chewy. It was just very limp and lifeless. The salad didn't look the freshest and was a little overdressed for my personal liking. Perhaps others enjoy CPK, but I wasn't really impressed having tried some other better pizza places in Seattle.

We brought over 30 people in very last minute and the restaurant cleared a whole section for us so we could sit together and worked hard to get our food to us quickly. Very impressed with the staff and their service. The food and menu options were great as we had several different dietary needs as well.

This was our first time here. Food was beyond amazing and everything tasted fresh.  The kids had pizza and said it was "very good" I had the pea and barley soup, half Cesar with avocado added and then the fried Mac n' Cheese which was surprisingly yummy.  Service was a bit slow but not the servers (I can't recall her name) fault. From what we could see, there was a bartender and two servers on the floor. Our server did as good a job as possible with the amount of tables she had.  Not sure staffing short was intended though as it was mid afternoon and we came right at the beginning of a "rush" our server was polite and best of all, did not hold us hostage with the check.  We felt bad for her even though she never once complained about how busy she was. She handled it like a pro and seemed to enjoy her job.  The other thing I think is worth mentioning: This restaurant does not add the tip like some in this area which shows me some social justice.  We left a 20% tip because of everything listed above.  I'm grateful to have given this place a shot. We will be back!

We had a small pizza to share,  a Caesar salad to share and we each had a soda with our lunch.  Came out nearly 50 dollars lighter.  Expensive for the quality of the food.  The pizza was light on the toppings (half of it was naked dough) and the Caesar salad was nearly free of croutons.  Next time I'll save money and get more to eat at the food court inside the mall.

Whenever I come in, I'm always greeted and seated right away. Their customer service is always on point which I always appreciate. My biggest rave goes to their beehive sangria bc it is absolutely delicious. I was thrown off when I saw that lavender was on it but it compliments the flavors so well. Their food is also always on point too. At least what I have had in the past.

Went back here yesterday for the first time in years, because I was nearby and I remember the BBQ chicken pizza being tasty.  It was OK, but verrry light on the cheese. My friend ordered the spaghetti bolognese, and thought it was pretty "blah".  I tasted it and agreed... at $15 for a small plate of pasta plus a ladle or two of sauce, it should have been amazing.  Very little flavor at all, and for a meat sauce, little discernable meat... more like crumbles with some kind filler or extender in them.  The total cost of the ingredients (the noodles are dirt cheap) had to have been under $2, maybe even under $1. There just wasn't any flavor, and so overpriced. Overall, expensive for what it is, and disappointing.
Getting some takeout pizza and salad the customer service is very friendly and the stars very clean

You know what, the food was pretty good. Well, I thought so. My wife said "it wasn't as good as she remembered." But the kicker here is the price. Everything is crazy expensive compared to what I expected. I've had better pizza for cheaper.  And considering you can get a frozen California Pizza Kitchen brand pizza in the store for almost a third of the price, it's kinda silly to go in.

This review is about the Manager of this location, named Louis. My companion has specific dietary needs, and originally wanted the Lemon chicken. When she found out the sauce would be too spicy for her, Louis discussed options for different sauces with her. He clearly wanted to please his customer. When that didn't work out, he suggested another meal that would be more to her liking. She tried something different, but the sauce provided still was too spicy, When she suggested he bring her a plain Caesar dressing, he did so with a smile on his face, I want to compliment him on his patience, goodness of heart, sense of humor, pleasant demeanor, and dedication to his customers. Thank you, Louis!

This was the third time we tried this CPK, trying to give it a chance.  The food was so-so, but the "background" music was so LOUD that I could not hear my wife sitting across from me!!  It was terrible.  The music in the restrooms was 3 times that LOUD!!  Why? On one visit they said they could not turn it down for some lame reason.  The background music is supposed to be in the background to enhance your dining experience, not ruin it.  The manager here must be near deaf, or just cares about his own desires instead of the comfort of his customers.  Good grief!  The choice of music was also terrible, just junk, people just screaming the words that you couldn't understand.  Everybody has different musical taste but why turn it all the way up so that customers cannot even hear each other?!  We won't be back a fourth time or ever.

California Pizza Kitchen has no business charging premium prices for their food. This is a Cheesecake Factory style Highschool Prom night date restaurant. That being said, I digress... After the friendly hostess seated us. I noticed the restaurant was maybe one third full of customers and they had 3-4 servers so I figured we'd get decent service. I was wrong. For some reason, the server we had seemed relatively attentive and friendly when she first came to take our drink order but then everything went downhill from there. For some reason my drink (and water) took a bit of time to arrive, but that wasn't really a big deal and the server even apologized for the wait. The first problem was when I asked for red paper flakes with my pizza and I never got it. By the time the server arrived to check on us(something she did maybe 1-2 times during our meal and was mostly ignoring us) I was almost done with my pizza and since we were trying to catch a movie I just put down my credit card and didn't mention the missing red pepper flakes. We did ask for a box for my wife's very undercooked and overpriced gluten free pizza; figuring we'd cook it more later at home. We thought about sending her pizza back, but we didn't want to miss our movie.  Well, we never got the box and on top of that the server had charged me for someone else's pizza and I had to flag down the friendly and helpful hostess to get our box and get our bill fixed. After our bill was mostly fixed we received a very halfhearted apology from our server and $50 later; we left.  Yeah that's right. 2 very small gluten free pizzas, no appetizers, a coke ($3.50) and a moscow mule(10 bucks) All of this was more than 50 dollars... Seattle isn't known for their pizza, but there are plenty of places that offer cheaper and higher quality gluten free pizza and have better service. On top of all that my stomach felt not so great afterward.  Save your money.

I love the sangrias at CPK! They are all awesome but the blood orange is my favorite. All of the pizzas are awesome as well. I really miss the cheese ravioli that they no longer make though. The hummus and pita bread is delicious and the salads are all super good too!

As a long-time lover of CPK, I can't explain my extreme disappointment with this location. My friend, Rach and I wanted salads and wine before a little shopping and I insisted on my favorite salad spot, CPK. We walked in and no one was at the host stand, so we waited. And waited. And waited. And waited. Finally, we decided to sit at the bar top. We were greeted by the enthusiastic and hospitable, Richard. He greeted us with menus and a smile then hurried over to run food. Clearly understaffed, we watched 2 servers (and 2 trainees..) Sprint around the restaurant, trying to give sufficient service.  We ordered drinks and salads and Richard was friendly and attentive, but clearly brief due to being stretched to thin. Our drinks came out perfect and we enjoyed them thoroughly. The girl with the two trainees was near, so we asked her for water and she said she would deliver them soon. She then within earshot said 'sometimes guests who aren't yours will bug you for things and you have deal with it'. Not exactly a comment appreciated by the ones who asked it. The AGM with a branded coat hardly noticed any of the customer service faux paus occurring around him.   Our food came out and it was consistently good on the way CPK is, which was great and appreciated. Overall, we were underwhelmed by the service of everyone except our bartender. I definitely won't be rushing back here.

We got one veggie and one bbq chicken pizza. They both tasted burnt. Feel like they were in the oven way too long. Even then the pizza just tasted nasty. I only ate a single slice and left the rest untouched. Didn't take it to go as well. Then the check game  and we both looked at each other we forgot how much they were charging for this burnt pizzas. Avoid at all cost.

Im a CPK junkie.... i AbSolutELy love CPk. The food is always so flavorful and great selection. This CPK was 2 thumbs down, the service was by far, the worst. The restaurant was empty n it took 10 minutes to get seated. I never got my bread, it took forever to refill my drink. To pay the bill was like a 15 minute wait. You have been warned.

Two stars. Why oh why? Well, mostly due to the poor service. Came here with a friend a couple of weekends ago and thought that I would have the usual CPK experience, but unfortunately, I was agitated for most of the time. What's crazy is that the place wasn't even packed and busy so I don't understand the breakdown. We our drinks came out quickly of course, then we ordered our food. As I was finishing my drink the waiter asked us after a long period of time, if we wanted some bread and dipping oil. We accepted, but didn't see the bread until, I kid you not, seconds before our food came out. So it was kinda like, what was the point of that? When the waiter put the bread on the table, he also put two WET plates in front of us then walked away. We couldn't believe it. I had to call him back and ask him to give us dry plates for our stale and hard bread. Once the food came out, I was already ready to leave. I had the jambalaya fettuccine. It was ok but I felt that they overdid the blackened aspect of the meat and the noodle to meat ratio was off. CPK is a chain so I won't vow to never return but hopefully this location can have better service next time.

The service and food I recieved was phenomenal; worth four stars, but when I was sitting at the bar on a busy Friday afternoon, I had a chance to observe how they run the kitchen and their staff.....not five stars.  There were probably 30 or so guests sitting in the dining area and only two servers and a manager-looking type woman....who didn't do much of anything even though she was frantically running around.  My Food: Starter- the guacamole  ($3.99) The portion was small for the hoard of chips that accompanied it. But it was very tasty. Up the portion and I would eat it for lunch everyday. Entree: half of the Asian Chicken Salad ($9.99) very good, I loved the crunch it had and the peanut sauce. Maybe a bit on the salty side, but I ate it all; I was hungry.  Monica was my server, but she was in a rush to assist her dining room guests so I was mostly assisted by the manager on duty.  Every time Monica asked the manager for help with an easy task, the manager would either attempt it and fail, or ignore her request all together. Even the hostess was able to dart to the kitchen and run some food!!!!!  At one point, the manager was ringing a to go order with the guest standing right there, and had some issue with the cash register! Wouldn't you know it, even though she was slammed, Monica stepped in and finished the transaction.  I also noticed that the hot pizzas were sitting out, waiting to be delivered for too long. No one was to blame as the two servers were trying to tackle the near impossible.  It's employees like Monica that really keep a restaurant in businesss. If her pace had slowed in the least, it would have resulted in angry customers and cold food. Even though she didn't order or deliver my food (the manager did), she was still very kind and checked in with me enough for me to tip her handsomely and give her an honest compliment on her work ethic.  Contrastingly, it's people like this manager that can drag a business down. More servers should be hired on the weekend so the employees don't experience burnout and the guests are happily fulfilled. Also, the manager should know how to do almost every task to better support the employees....just in case it gets busy (like today). Running food, taking orders, making drinks and correctly ringing to-go orders.  They really have great food, but the management side of things needs to shape up.
I use to go to this place all the time for lunch but am very sad they took my favorite cheese revoli away. The food is just not cooked the same way. Sad I won't be going here much.

The wait staff was out of sync with our table tonight.  They made a mistake with our order.  We had to ask a couple of times to get bread.  The man from the kitchen delivering the food slammed the plates on our table. The salad was a soggy pile of wilted greens not what we are accustomed to get.  I hope we don't get sick.  I am really not satisfied with the treatment we got at this location tonight.

It's hard for me to decide how many stars to give. My most recent visit went from hugely disappointing to remarkable in the span of 10 minutes. Let me explain. I get the Thai chicken pizza nearly every time, and nearly every time it's great. Except once. After placing my order and waxing effusive to my friend about how incredible the Thai chicken pizzas are, the waiter dropped off a dry, sad looking, flat, flimsy pie absent of adequate sauce or toppings. My reaction was mildly visceral. I took one bite. To be fair, it tasted marginally better than it looked. But it was not nearly as good as I remembered. A 3 out of 10 at best. Now I hardly ever send food back. Let's just say I'm paranoid about disgruntled kitchen crews adding foreign "toppings" to my order. But today, a CPK District Manager happened to be making the rounds, asking how everyone's food was. When she approached our table, I told her my dish was "OK, but it used to be really good in the past." She apologized and said: "Let me take care of that for you," and whisked the sorry thing away. About 10 minutes later she returned, apologizing again for the wait. And what she placed in front of me was nothing short of legendary. The crust was perfect. The sauce was perfect. The toppings were piled comically high. It looked almost too good to eat. But I ate it. And it was the one of the best pizzas I've ever had.  Now she didn't say so, but I think the DM made my pizza that day. But whoever made it got it right. I only wish every CPK zaw was that amazing.

Depressing. As soon as yo walk in you get  a slap in the face of '"dirty bleach towel"' stench. Greasy, brown stinky bleach water mindlessly smeared over every surface with a similarly soiled bar towel. As if the bleach bucket was some magical potion that no mater how vile the object, it would be miraculously cleansed. Baptized at the font of sanitation. You get used to it eventually. This is anti-food! It Was food. It must have been food at some point! Just because this model of a restaurant is everywhere doesn't mean it should be! If you don't have any other options in your area then it is a different story, but in Seattle, these types of "restaurants" don't need to exist.  And it's expensive!

One of my favorite chain restaurants. Food - As expected - good Staff - Very nice and extremely friendly So why the 2 star review? Placed an online order over 1 hour in advance for pickup - 5 minutes before pulling into the CPK parking lot got a call from them that one of the items I ordered (avocado egg rolls) was out. This was my whole reason for choosing CPK! The replacement option was fine and so was the pizza - but I really was craving the egg rolls. And they were out of bread.

location: South Jordan, Salt Lake City, United States
review: It's been years since I've gone to CPK and I think I know why...I wasn't that impressed this time around. The host was very nice and service was excellent, but the food wasn't too good.  The bf ordered the infamous BBQ chicken pizza but honestly, we both preferred buying and eating the frozen CPK brand versions at Safeway (for less than half the price!). The size is exactly the same as the frozen version and taste pretty much the same.  I love cajun food and perhaps CPK isn't the place to order that but I thought I'd give the jambalaya fettuccine a try. It was decent but not nearly as delicious as the cajun jambalaya pasta from the Cheesecake Factory (Oh my, that pasta is amazing!!).  Overall, it was mediocre and a bit pricey for the amount and quality of food.

Disappointed by this location! First we ordered curbside takeaway. They weren't busy at all but it took them 5+ mins to even notice us waiting outside. No bread or utensils when I requested for them. No bacon on my pizza when I paid extra for it. After spending almost $100 and driving 30+ mins I'm sadly disappointed.

LOVE CPK!!!!!!  My husband and I get the same thing almost every time we come and we just split everything: - Fried mac and cheese appetizer - omg good - BBQ chicken pizza - SO GOOD! - Four cheese ravioli - amazing This location is great too.  While the parking sucks, you can still find parking, just have to walk a bit usually.  I've always had great service here, and had especially amazing service last night.  Great place!

My friend and I decided that we needed a bit of nostalgia in our lives so we came here for dinner on a Sunday evening. The Bellevue location used to be our hangout spot in high school so we decided to go back and reminisce.  Even though it's great to know that this place has updated its menu, I was bummed that they didn't have the Thai chicken pasta anymore. So I opted for an Italian chopped salad instead. There wasn't enough dressing, not enough meat, and the "large" portion still wasn't that big.  However, we did see the mayor of Seattle here which was pretty cool. My friend didn't believe that it was him until I showed her a Youtube video of him...and then she believed me.  Anyway, this place is just meh. I'm sure the pizza is still decent...I'd go for that the next time I need some high school flashbacks.

Never been to a CPK. The wild mushroom pizza was delicious as was the champagne vinaigrette on the house greens. I have made a lot of strawberry shortcakes in my life but none as good as the one we had tonight.  The manager Adam was outstanding. He learned it was our first visit and treated us like royalty. We were expecting a run of the mill mall restaurant but the great food and exceptional service from Adam and his staff made it a fantastic evening. Thanks to all of you at CPK in Northgate for a great dining experience. Can't wait to come back.
Great service with variety of food choices - even for the diabetic recipes to choose from.  Dan K.

We occasionally have this delivered to the office for catered lunch... I would rather eat ANYTHING else!! Need a reason not to like CPK? Check out their health inspection scores... improper cold storage, not having proper hand washing stations in place, no barriers between bare hands and ready to eat foods... YUCK
It's a CPK. Good tasting pizza. Decent prices. The staff was friendly and the food was really good.  Tried the dessert this time too and it was really good. Highly recommended! JR

Have had this several times before, and it were always good ! I also tried to order to-go, and they offered me their french bread appetizer, which was very interesting (I took the offer haha).  Also, try their tiramisu cake for desert, I had it once and now I'm craving for it everyday!

I came in tonight and ordered the shrimp lettuce wraps. They were delicious and arrived very quickly. My server was Alicia and she was very lovely and informative. My friend had some questions about certain items and she knew everything! We both ordered the mahi mahi tacos and they were  . Totally recommend to everyone! It was a tad busy but Alicia took care of us and everyone around us! We will be back soon!

I am from Texas and I love California Pizza Kitchen. I have been traveling for 9 months and a lot up the state's I was in didn't have one.  I'm also very financially challenged so I can't afford it right now. But I heard about their reward program and that you get a free small plate. I drove 20 miles of course in the rain to get my sausage flat bread which is usually sooo delicious.  But not today.  Today I waited20 to 25 minutes for a ice cold flat bread with maybe3 sausage on it.  I know what the normal flat bread tastes like so when I'm back in Texas and making money again I will be back. But I would not be back to this one if I lived here.  Grant it was free but as someone who 20 years ago waited tables ALL the food should come out of the kitchen the same free or $500 a plate.   I'm feeling bummed for not get a sausage flat bread fix

We normally dont have anything bad to say about CPK & i like going there because i KNOW what to expect and I KNOW what im getting. Tonight i was incredibly disappointed!!  The flatbread was gross and soggy.  It was DRENCHED IN WET SPINACH. Globs of spinach inundated the flat bread.  The kungpao spaghetti was bland. ALL YOU TASTED was chili peppers & Garlic. No flavor n hardly any sauce whatsoever!! The tequila chicken pasta was okay. NOT ANYWHERE as tasty as it normally is but it was not awful.  When i called to ask if they had a new chef i was told by Carl (the shift manager) that he would talk to them, but they dont have any new food preparation staff!!  He didnt take the opportunity to earn my confidence back or offer to replace those items! TO ADD INSULT TO INJURY; I TIPPED THE THE TAKE OUT PERSON 20%!!!!  This is what i get?!?!  SHAME ON YOU CPK FOR NOT TRYING TO REMEDY THIS SITUATION OR FOR TRYING TO GAIN MY BUSINESS & CONFIDENCE BACK. Regrettably I will take my business elsewhere. BUCA DI PEPPO will enjoy my business even MORE withou CPK in my rotation!

We went on Saturday night, were seated quickly, greated by an extremely friendly waitress.  Ordered pretty quick and got our food ASAP.  It was really great service.  My only small little complaint was my pizza crust was a little burnt.  It will still good however, warm and very very fresh.  She also re-filled our drinks religiously!  This was our second time - the first time, the manager gave us a free appetizer for being new.  The first time our waiter had a little bit dry sense of humor - made some interesting comments but the manager made up for that.   We'll be back for quick and easy pizza night.

I came here while I was visiting Seattle and I really enjoyed this place! I ordered the shrimp and mushroom cream penne and it was really delicious! To spice up my meal, I also ordered a raspberry mojito which was absolutely delicious! The waitress was really nice!

Growing up in Hawaii, you know you love California Pizza Kitchen. As far as restaurant chains go, CPK is second to none. Their service is always great, food is consistent regardless of location, and menu changes occur seasonally to keep things fresh. This Northgate location is no different. Second year GM Eric C. Moffitt has gone great lengths to raise standards in regards to service, store presentation, and general guest satisfaction. Always taking good care of regulars, he gives first time guests the same hospitable treatment. If you're near a CPK, give it a shot. I can't speak for all the stores in the company, but the ones in Hawaii and this particular one on Seattle get six stars out of five from me. Ask for Mike A. or Chris to be your server. You wont be disappointed.
Habanero pizza, with hair in the sauce. Tasty? You judge it!  Never coming back anymore! Boycott

Well it's what you would expect from CPK. Typical mall food, huge menu, large portions, ect. Our server was exceptionally nice though so I will mention that because I find that rare at a place like this. The half portion of the salads are really big so unless you are starving or plan on taking it to go there is no need to grab a full size. They have so many options of salads, pizzas, ect you could stare at the menu for hours but you probably can't go wrong on a lot of the options.
Garlic chicken pizza, B52-coffee,spinach appetizer ,BBQ chicken salad, etc.  @CPK north gate mall, waiter is Joshua, he's so nice, handsome.

Not impressed with the service however the salad I had was great. Roasted veggie salad...DIETING!! :(  I put a lot of value on serve and this waitress was very slow and would walk away in the middle of a sentence so we had to ask twice for the rest of our order. So half the table had their order and the other half watched them eat until the rest of the food arrived.  the kids got all hopped up on sugar (hot fudge sundaes). Still full of energy at home rethinking desert next time we go to dinner. The honey chicken pizza on the kids menu is actually really good.

After a strenuous day of holiday shopping, Kim and I stumbled, starving, into California Pizza Kitchen with our many packages.  A restaurant attached to the mall was our only requirement.  (And out of the food court, as Kim has certain aversions to watching people eat fried chicken from Panda Express within 2 feet of her.  Me?  No problem eating in a food court.) I was pleasantly surprised at the menu -- pizza (duh), pastas of all kinds, fresh salads, and a variety of appetizers including egg rolls, tuscan hummus, and crab cakes.  Although several of the cheesy pastas being inhaled around me were calling my name, I went with my gut and chose the Waldorf Salad, which is my favorite kind of salad -- sweet dressing, with nuts, apples, grapes, crumbled cheese, and chicken.   This salad was exactly what I needed, because as the weather gets colder, I seem to eat take-out much more than I should!  :)  Our wonderful, lovely server in the bar recommended the "Regular" portion ($2 less) because the large was evidently HUUUGE, and my "regular" size was more than enough to fill me up! Kim got the hummus (too garlic-y and tangy for my taste) with warm, soft delicious pita triangles, of which I ate many.   All in all, it ended one of my favorite kind of days -- a great meal and productive shopping trip!  And the ONLY thing I bought for myself was a wallet and this salad, huzzah!!!

As far as chain restaurants go, I feel that CPK is pretty good.  When I was studying abroad in China, the second we got to Shanghai, we headed to CPK because we needed something besides that Chinese food in Beijing.  Good times...anyway! Reviewing the Northgate location. The hummus plate is a great appetizer.  A good portion, perfect for sharing and healthy. For main courses, I've had the kung pao spaghetti, the greek pizza with avocado and the mushroom and goat cheese pizza. Ever since I've had the greek pizza, I never order anything else.  This is like a fresh greek salad on bread. Love it. The honey wheat crust is also excellent (maybe not on the greek pizza).  I would probably skip the kung pao spaghetti. Its been a while since I last went, but writing this review has made me want to go again!

I already filed a complaint through their national office, so this will be brief and to the point: Restaurant closes at 10p, I asked if they were still serving at 9:50p and was seated. Party of 2. - 9:51p Waitress #1 immediately appears announcing the kitchen was closing and we needed to order, I order drinks but ask for at least a minute to decide - 9:53p Waiter #2 delivers wrong drink order, but takes entre order, promising to get correct drunk order. We order 2 full pizzas and a salad. They never did correct the drink order. - No bread brought to the table (forgot about this until their national Web page asked if the free bread was brought as it should be). - 10:05p waitress #1 brings salad and pizzas together, announcing that restaurant is closing.  I get it:  everyone wants to go home.  you don't really want us here... despite the fact you seated us. But salads are traditionally appetizers and brought before the meal. thanks for trying to speed us along by bringing it all at once, but... never mind. Sent back the salad since it wasn't brought first. - 10:10p busboy begins bussing table next to us, bringing his fully loaded tray of used dishes while the couple next to us WERE STILL EATING. I get ready to yell at busboy if he should do the same to me. Busboy appears to notice the look on my face and goes back inside. - 10:12p Waitress #1, to her credit does ask if the *food* is okay. - No further checks on us; waitress #1 and Waiter #2 ignore us, despite cashing out couple sitting next to us. I have to call waitress #1 as she walks past us to ask her for refills on our empty glasses. - Waitress #1 lets me know they have "dumped all the lemonade because they're closed" (!?) so no refills are available. I asked for the general manager... who appeared offended that I bothered him and was complaining.  His only response was that they close at 10 and, the restaurant was now closed. Oh... but he took the $2 lemonade off the bill. We packed up the food and left by 10:20p.  Sorry I kept them late. Not going back. I spend my $$$ at restaurants who appear happy that I'm there and interested in giving me a place to relax.

Service was very poor. The boyfriend and I only ended up ordering a beer. The server that was waiting on us never even bothered checking up on us and seeing if we wanted food or not, despite the place being practically empty.
