And all the cooks were sitting around at one booth doing nothing. Don't know if it was their break time or what, but pretty sure they shouldn't all be on break at the same time. Not much of a menu either. I definitely won't be coming back to this CPK anytime soon.

Better than average mall food. I had the pesto sauce penne, which as decent. However, in a city the size of Seattle, you've got to do better than decent when it comes to pasta as there are so many places out there that do superb food. I would like to compliment my server, Michael. It was dinner time when I went in and that place was BUSY. My server never missed a beat and was on top of it the entire time while never seeming rushed. As a former bartender, I know how hard that is to pull off.

Upon glancing at the other reviews it is completely mixed. I do respect that because everyone's experience is different. Mine however has always been up to par. I've never had any service issues or food issues. I've been many many times and found the wait staff to be pleasant and accommodating. There are occasions when things get busy and it might take them a bit longer to get back to you but they are normally on point and they aren't bothersome.  I've had the entire variety of spring rolls which are my faves as far as appetizers go, my husband normally get's the Chipotle pizza whereas I'm more diverse. I have sampled numerous items on the menu and have yet to be disappointed. The salads are delish and large in portions...event the half salads are decent sizes and filling. The Chinese chicken salad is so good! They also have a new entree featuring the cedar plank salmon with corn succotash and I thought it was to die for. Personally it had the right amount of spice, it was cooked perfectly, and the fish was just delicious. I couldn't stop talking about it after I left. $18 for that dish and I thought it was worth it.  I also like the fact that they have a separate booklet that helps you compare nutrition facts and calories for those who are dieting. Because I don't get the pizza, I can say I haven't had any issues with greasiness or oily foods. Everything seems so fresh and tastes good. For such a large menu I commend that cooking brigade for getting all those dishes out. Keep up the good work and keep it clean!!!

I know California Pizza Kitchen isn't really in the realm of what most would consider capable of being five stars, but frankly, I consider this location to be best represented with the description of TGI Friday's on Ecstasy. I honestly don't even go here for pizza or entrees of any kind - it is purely a Fru Fru Cocktail and comfort food appetizers haven in my book, and for that, I adore it.   My favorite drinks - All of the Margaritas, all of the Muh Jeye Toes, and the effin' mudslide.  Whoever decided to make a chocolate milk shake that gets you drunk is both a genius and a moron, and I love to hate him/her.  If it weren't for the 500 calories per cup, I'd probably just hook up a mudslide IV while I'm at work.   Bitesss -  "Hey... some customers are complaining that our food isn't unhealthy enough." "Maybe we should add macaroni and cheese to the menu..." "Yeah but some might not realize that pasta and sauce isn't automatically unhealthy..." "What if we add twice AS MUCH sauce... " "That could work, but there's gotta be a way to take that next step..." "Oh... sh*t!  We'll deep fry it!" "It's so obvious." Crispy Mac n Cheese - Duh.  Avocado Egg Rolls - Duh.  Dynaymite Shrimp - You know where I'm going with this.... I don't need to get into it, just like I don't need to be able to fit through the door when I leave.   Indulge yourself.

A good place to get dinner at the mall. In fact, my new favorite place if I want to pair it with some shopping or a salon visit. Not complicated or fancy, but I like the vibe way better than other chain mall restaurants. Their Moroccan chicken salad has a bunch of good ingredients. Their pizzas are good, I've had mushroom and enjoyed it. I like that they do half-size wine pours. The server we had last time went out of his way to greet us and make us feel welcome, and I had a very friendly server the last time. Note: You can get $5 off if you sign up for their e-club. I'm always looking for a good deal, and I thought this would be cheaper but after a half chicken salad, wine, tax/tip, my bill ran up to $18, so I would forgo the drink next time to save monies.

Food was good, service not so good. Perhaps they where short staffed but either way I wouldn't go back to this location. I've been to the one in Bellevue for my friends bday about a month ago and it was great. We where with a large group then (about 8 ppl) and we left happy, so my coworkers decided to come to the one here in Northgate for my birthday and another girls   Bday and there was about 9 or so of us. In Bellevue CPK my friend got a free bday dessert, but not here at Northgate. The waiter was super busy and it was hard to get a min with him, 2 girls tried to tell him about the bdays in the group but no luck, he walked off to quickly. We ordered the Moroccan chicken salad (one of my favs) as well as another salad and two pizzas. The food was good but being that was familiar with Moroccan salad I noticed it was missing two main ingredients: squash and beets. When we brought it to the waiters attention he said he would check on it, turns out the restaurant was out of both items. He removed the salad from our bill and gave us a second salad of the one we ordered at no charge but it didn't come out until it was time to leave (we told the waiter we only had one hour and we where there for lunch) he boxed it for us. We asked the waiter for water for some of late arrivers but it never came. We also asked for more silver wear and it never came (she ended up eating her salad with a salad spoon). We realized 10 min into the meal we needed another pizza but we couldn't get it order because the waiter didn't come by in time to put the order in. The ice teas never where refilled and I left hungry. We let the manger know and he apologized but honestly it shouldn't get to that point when you go out to eat. Hopefully the bad service was a fluke but I'm not  going back to that CPK location to find out.

I had enough points on my American Express card to get a $25 gift card to this place so at least I did not spend my own money. Used it to purchase 2 bland pizzas that were very small for a $12 pizzas.  Workers looked at me like I was there to detonate a suicide vest  when I walked in with my gym bag since I was taking a bus home. This chain is a scam. I guess if you hear enough people say a chain is so wonderful  and so great someone will believe it. Their pizza is only a little bit better than Little Caesars but a lot smaller and a lot  more costly. I would never go here again. Horrible value and really small pizzas along with  a bizarre entree selection.

I come in regularly - sometimes alone, sometimes w/ my husband.  I love the staff - they are very good (waitpeople) and the food is pretty good.  Normally, I'd leave 5 stars for those two reasons, but today, they get bumped down to 2.  My waitress, Madison, was wonderful - attentive and friendly and fast.  However, I came in early - 11:15am and only two other people were there at the counter.  The music was very loud - I think they turn it up when they are setting up the restaurant.  This is superbowl Sunday - the game is set to begin at 3pm and the TV's were on, but weren't playing through the speakers.  I asked Madison to turn down the music just a little bit and she consented.  About 3 minutes later, the sound switched to the TV and got incredibly loud.  So loud that the words distorted.  I looked up and over at the food prep area (which is open for everyone to see) and the entire cook staff and manager, Carl, were staring at me.  It was very odd and seemed to be a FU to me.  I can't understand why - they know me there and I am always very polite and tip well so there was no reason for hostility.  And, it wasn't an accident since they were just staring at me.  The TV was broadcasting some inane interview with foreign reporters about what they thought about the upcoming game - so it wasn't even that interesting or relevant.  After about 2 minutes, Carl turned down the TV to the original, still-too-loud volume, and I guess the message was that I should be thankful for that volume because of what it could have been.  I doubt he would have done that if there were other customers besides me at a booth eating and two guys at the counter drinking.  The waitress came back and apologized and said that the manager really wanted to hear the game.  What game?  There was no game playing and we were 4 hours before it.  About 15 minutes later, a couple was seated at the booth behind me.  Madison waited on them too and they could not hear her.  She kept raising her voice and still the man couldn't understand what she was telling him about this menu options.  It was ridiculous.  Maybe Carl was in a bad mood because he had to work today - whatever his reason, his behavior was very unprofessional and immature and everyone that works there recognized that.

Yes, this place is a chain. But I worked at the mall for about a year and a half, and if I wanted to get food after work at someplace a bit nicer than the food court or Chipotle, this was one of the better options. I would not recommend it for PIZZA pizza (tomato sauce, cheese, pepperoni, GREASE) but they do have a lot of interesting specialty pizzas. The menu is quite large and diverse. It does kind of have that overall blandness that I've come to associate with chain restaurants -- while everything I've tried is good, nothing was particularly exciting or unexpected. Actually, that's not true -- they have pizzas with salad ON THEM. That's pretty unusual, unless it's a California thing; I wouldn't know. I haven't tried one because they just sound weird. The personal pizza is usually a bit too big for me to eat in one sitting, but leftovers are nice. It's worth getting a box for your leftovers instead of stuffing yourself here, because they have good desserts. Key Lime Piiiieeeee.... The drinks are also good. I love love love their dessert coffee drink Almond Joy, which includes amaretto, coconut rum and chocolate syrup. Yummmm. Here's the thing that always bothers me about this place, though. They have a very strange service policy, that apparently is enforced by corporate, that I don't like. Servers all introduce themselves in their flat, scripted way ("Hi! I'm John and I'll be serving you tonight! Can I tell you about our specials?") and every time I've eaten there, the manager on duty has come around at least once during the meal and asked us how we are doing. This might seem like a nice touch, but it feels very corporate-enforced. I've had two separate managers do this, a man and a woman, and both of them seemed almost suspicious of their servers. "Is everything okay? Reeeally?" It was a weird attitude to have, because we were doing just fine, and it made me feel like there was something weird going on except that this seems to happen every time (I've asked some co-workers if they had that happen too, and they all did.) So, Corporate, if you're reading this, STOP MAKING THEM DO IT! It's really annoying and weird. The food and drinks are quite good, but the most this place will get is four stars (really 3.5) because of the weird service issues.

I have been to this particular location a few times, but I have been to CPK's all over, and always have a similar experience. The service is good, and the food is good. Yes, they are somewhat overpriced. Which is probably part of the reason I don't go here that often.  BUT, they have good pizza. And in the end, that is all that really matters. I LOVE their honey wheat crust. It is especially good with the chicken club pizza, which has bacon, avocado, tomatoes, and lettuce and mayo. It sounds weird, but is actually delicious! I am also a huge fan of their thin crust Sicilian pizza. Oddly enough, their signature bbq chicken pizza isn't that great.  I think the only bad experience I ever had here is that I ordered an iced tea, and I took a drink and it tasted awful. So I told my waitress that it tasted funny, she instead brought me a diet coke, and in a few minutes came back to let me know that it turns out someone had accidentally made iced coffee instead of iced tea. The fact that she looked into it, and fixed the problem was really awesome.  The wait can be kind of long on the weekends, but it has a pretty odd location at North Gate, so sadly it doesn't get as much business as it should.  Surprisingly, their frozen pizzas are really good too.
Wait staff is always super friendly.  Ask if they have any specials.  Waiter told me the menu is changing and the Greek pizza is going away! Get it before it's gone.

I have been to California Pizza Kitchen a couple of times.I really enjoyed it at both locations Bellevue and Northgate. The food is great and the service is excellent. The staff is prompt, accurate and very  friendly. The menu selection is great. It's innovative with alot of variety. I have had their pizza, pasta and appetizers. I highly recommend the works pizza, the spinach artichoke dip, the quesadilla small plate and the tequila fetucchini. Both locations had a great environment and overall atmosphere. The experience has been great both times.

"Really?!" My first thought when my server brought me my $5.79 chicken quesadilla. This so-called "small plate" was actually the tiniest quesadilla I've ever seen. It would have been cute if I weren't ravenous and pissed off about paying nearly 6 bucks for a "meal" that I ate in 4 bites, literally. The flavor was good but for the price it was a joke. C'mon CPK, don't do me like dat!

Wish my review was based on their food, however we never made it that far. Myself and four others in my family decided to dine here, yet left fifteen minutes into our dinner because we didn't get service. The hostess sat us, said our server would be over and then we never saw anyone at our table. They weren't busy, in my eyes, yet we were ignored. Just because of service we won't be back.

California Pizza Kitchen is one of those places where I can go with a group and everyone can find something they love.  I often have this with my family, where certain family members are picky with what kind of food they prefer.   Normally when I dine here, we usually order a California club pizza, roasted garlic pizza, the BBQ chicken salad, and the baby clam linguine with lemon cream sauce.  Out of the bunch, the club pizza is my favorite mainly because it has bacon and avocado.  The rest of the dishes are good but I always make sure I get a slice of the club pizza when I'm here.   The ambiance isn't that great but it's good enough for family dinners when kids are included.
Nothing special. As a specialty pizza place one would think this place must have something special and good but no, just a thin crust pizza for bit more damage  on your wallet.

I usually forget about CPK but when I remember it's here and am in the area it's a good choice!  This place is often kid-central. Being in the mall it's easy to go after a day of shopping or to grab a bite before seeing a movie at Regal Thornton. Service is always prompt and pleasant. Prices are good. I really like the pizza!  Last time I was here I requested an olive oil topping instead of cheese (annoying, I know. I promise I'm not normally "one of those customers"). They said no problem and the pizza was great! I like their pepperoni.

So where to begin with this more than delightful mall restaurant that isn't just a total piece of crap off the highway? Well, let me tell it, it's ah-may-zing.  I always get their garlic cream fettuchini with chicken, apple juice, and (if I have the room, as the sauce is heavy but not grab-your-gut and scream heavy) the butter cake with Ice cream. Yeah, they have tiramisu and this chocolate brownie that's a 7.5/10, but the butter cake is seriously like a big O. It's delicious and scrumptious and you will literally consider wanting to marry the heir to this chain of restaurants because their food is that damn good.

Ok food and annoying service. Starting with the food... We tried a couple of the new small plates (Mac & cheese bites and avocado dip).  The Mac and cheese has good texture, but not very hot.  The dip was bland and a smaller portion than expected.  The remaining food was fairly standard. On to the service... Just as we opened our menus (less than 1 min after sitting down) our waitress came by and asked what we wanted.  I assumed she hadn't seen us just sit down and was willing to give her the benefit of the doubt.  She came back about 2 min later to ask again when we were clearly having a conversation about what to eat.   Throughout the remainder of the meal, she was less intrusive, but it seems the company had mandated a 10 minute minimum between table visits.
Tasty Veggie Pizza. Outdoor sitting was the nice experience to enjoy food by sitting side by of firepit table.

The food here is pretty much as mediocre and forgettable as you can get. Their BBQ chicken pizza is definitely the best they have to offer, which is just plain mediocre. Steer clear from their pastas - they are not cooked or seasoned well, and other dishes. (I haven't had their salads or soups though) However, what is really appalling is their service. The staff are as unorganized as you can get. I didn't even know who my server was (since 5 different people had to interface with me to get a pizza.. uh?). Expect awkward delays in getting refills, getting your check, etc. The staff are constantly chatting each other up rather than doing business. You can't even tell who is a staff member since only half have uniforms. This is not a one time issue, I've been there a few times, and it has always been utterly appalling.

I haven't been to a CPK in years, but I had time to kill to avoid traffic. I was not feeling great, so I just wanted something reliable.  Good: The mushroom pizza was very good when adding the truffle oil. If I ordered it again, I would add arugula.  The managers buzzing around were very friendly and on top of things. Surprisingly good beer selection, but you have to ask about what's on tap.  Most of the staff I encountered was very friendly.  Free wifi is always a bonus.  Meh:  The uniforms are so dated. The headsets that all servers and managers wear are really cheesy, bordering on annoying. No, not bordering on - they are really annoying. No real reason why, jmho.  Bad: My server said I had poor taste because I like mushrooms and truffles. I get it was joking around, but inappropriate.  The interior of the restaurant is incredibly dated, to the point of being uncomfortable. It felt like a Denny's with all the low booths and bad design. I'm not an interior decorator, so I can't put my finger on it, other than do say it could use refreshing.  The truffle oil is very expensive and tasted like a 'fake' truffle oil. It was so strong that I assume it was enhanced with synthetic scent/flavor.  With 5 tables or so in the entire place, I fell victim to mediocre distracted service. Two basic requests were forgotten (water and condiments).  Only the manager knew what was in a basic bar drink that was ordered. The first thing a bartender should learn are things like a Collins, a press, a sour, a spritzer... No happy hour.  I'm not one that frequents chains like this, but didn't know the area and needed something reliable and easy to navigate.  I remember visiting early CPKs years and years ago when they first opened in SoCal, and I was happy to see that the pizza quality was still as good as remembered, again, understanding what it is. But, because of the interior and flip server, I do not plan on returning the next time I have time to kill in that area.

CPK never does me wrong. Every restaurant I go to has consistently delish pizzas and this visit was no different. They recently changed their pizza dough, that no longer has high fructose corn syrup (Thank you!!) and it tastes much better than it did before. The crust is more 'fluffy' and has more flavor. I used to not eat crusts, but this crust is delicious even without any toppings. The Garlic Chicken Pizza was amazing. I'm hoping that this will become a regular menu item. The service was fantastic as well. Our waitress was really friendly, quick with the refills, and was overall was happy to be there. This is at the Northgate Mall, so it can be busy and parking can be a pain, but if you are famished from doing your shopping, this is a good place to go.

For a chain restaurant, I was pleasantly surprised by my visit here. The servers were friendly and the servings were so filling I'm taking leftovers home! If you're shopping and want a quick but yummy meal, I'd definitely recommend CPK.

I had been to CPK years ago before I knew my allergy was a gluten allergy. When I found out I couldn't eat anything delicious anymore, I was bummed. I was also bummed that CPK wasn't jumping onto the GF bandwagon like most places.  Until recently. And they really did their homework. They are certified GF and take every precaution. It's wonderful. They have also perfected their pizza crust recipe so that they have a thin, crispy crust that you can't even tell is Gluten Free! They cook the pizza in a separate place with a separate person and a manager delivers it to your table. No cross contamination. And it tastes great! My favorite is the BBQ Chicken.  They don't have any other GF entrees, but some of the salads and things are safe. I'm so glad I have a reason to come back to CPK! If you're severely allergic, like I am, then you can safely eat here.

Hey, CPK, time to train your curbside people for a little more manners. I drive in for my pizza (it's late, I'm hungry, I splurged). $13.14. I give the woman who walks out $20.15.  "Do you want change?" she says. "Um, yes." I say. Silence. "It's a twenty." I say. Several minutes later out she comes with my change. "Do you want the penny?" she says. "Um, I don't really care." I say, leaving her a dollar just to get the hell out of there, meanwhile thinking FUCK YOU! So, yeah, I don't think I'll be coming back.
Frequently visited this place...good service and food. The wifi sucks though.

A group of 4 of us went tonight, it was my first (and last time). Food was bland, we ordered salads and entrees and the entrees came out about 3 minutes after the salad. The waitress apologized for this, so even she realized it was messed up. By the time we got to the entrees they were cold. It didn't really matter since there was no real flavor to the entrees, although we all liked our salads. With all the great restaurants in Seattle why go here?

I find it a little awkward when I go to California Pizza Kitchen when I'm not in California anymore. I never gave it a second thought but now when I read the menu, I imagine a blonde surfer dude advertising the healthy and fresh California-style of food you came to this restaurant for! My favorites at this restaurant remain the thai crunch salad, which I resorted to after they took away the miso seafood salad. I still mourn the loss of that salad. I'm adventurous with pizzas, but I like the pear and gorgonzola or the thai chicken. I'm pretty sure there used to be a peking duck that was great but not on the menu anymore. That's another thing I'm disappointed about of CPK. I've been going here since my childhood because it's one of the few non-asian restaurants my chinese food eating mom liked. I've seen their menu change a lot in recent years and much of what I grew to love is gone. It's sad. I have a feeling their consolidating their menu to get rid of ingredients that were only used in certain entrees and thus weren't price effective to keep in the kitchen. Having crab just for one salad or duck just for one pizza probably isn't smart.  CPK isn't a very expensive restaurant, and their pizzas seem to have gotten bigger even though the price hasn't changed much. I'll still come here because I'm used to it and familiar restaurant decor makes me happy, but I'll always remember that I used to like it better.

While I understand dinner time can be busy...but we waited for a good 45 minutes for our to go order (Hawaiian pizza and a half salad) only to find out the pizza is cold. Ended up reheating the pizza in our oven.

Got the mini arugula starter salad and the jambalaya fettuccine. Unhealthy dinner tonight! I earned it though worked out and ate virtually no carbs... So ready to eat. The fettuccine was not cooked all the way and the seafood was rubbery and overcooked but the portion was huge and it filled me up so whatever I guess.

This is a good pizza place. It's got a classier vibe and the food is tasty. I've been to this location a few times and have been pleased. The staff is friendly and attentive and the food has been good. It's a little pricey but worth it for a night out.

I just decided to give them another chance. I decided I would order a pizza via Postmates (a new app that helps with deliveries). I ordered a tostada pizza, and my postmate driver just texted me to let me know they were out of tostada pizza. REALLY!?! How the hell are you out of a pizza?! Considering you are a PIZZA kitchen, this just blows my mind. You are really not helping in wanting to give your store a second chance.

I only give it a 2 star because of the service.  The food is great once it was right.  We placed a take out order and first the waitress mistaken my pizza for a salad but fixed it no problems. I get back to the hotel ready to feed my children only to see the main toppings are not even on my pizza or in my bag. I call and the Manger argued w me about everything. Long story short is if you order take out make sure everything is right before you go unless you want the Manger to say you are basically stupid.

Walked into Cpk and sat for 15 minutes and  a waiter  still didn't come and help me. I finally got up and asked the greeter for some help. She took my order. I found it odd that it took them so long to help me. The greeter was a life saver for the server. She actually took my order and got my drink for me. Having said that as usual the food was great I always have the Thai crunch salad and a lemonade.

I've been to this CPK about two or three times. Yes CPK is a chain. So don't expect this location to have any better food than any of the other CPK's out there. However, CPK does have some delicious pizza. For some reason I'm a big fan of their Rosemary chicken and potato pizza (yeah I know potato on a pizza?!?) and their BLT Pizza (or is it a california club?) anyway regardless CPK has good service, yummy pizza, and all at reasonable prices. Getting a table at this location has also never been an issue. So that's good.  ~G

I went here with my family last night, and lets just say, I've had better, even from here...which is why I'm giving it 3 stars and not 2 because I am very well aware of what kind of service this place is capable of. First we had a party of 7, there were plenty of booths that were open up against the wall where some of us could sit in a booth and some in a chair, but we got seated in a booth right next to the kitchen (which had a very peculiar and suspicious smell) and they pulled up an extra chair so someone was right in the line of fire.  Our waitress was gone for, pretty much the entire time. We needed refills on drinks, more napkins for the kids, and there was no one to ask because we were stuck in this little corner the entire time. At one point we even had to get up and go find someone to get the kids dessert because they were getting a little ancy waiting for it.  Regardless of the service the food was still good. Chicken Piccata and the original chopped salad with gorgonzola. The salad probably being my favorite, delicious! I'm sure I'll be back here in the future, I'm not just in too much of a hurry...

Not only was our food delicious, our server was A+. It's a little irritating when waiters give you the same ol' spiel about trying their new dishes, but Chris was fantastic. He was quick, he was friendly but not too friendly, and also reminded me of a real life Santino impersonating Tim Gunn going on a date with Andrae to Red Lobster. I'd come back just for Chris.
Beer  is 6.29 too pricey salad had chunks of bacon too big server brought bill without asking if we wanted anything else.  We did!

Not super thrilled with the service. Our waitress didn't seem too bright. Watching her attempt to make my friend's Smith and Wesson was akin to watching Spongebob and Patrick figure a quantum physics problem on a blackboard. She didn't have a clue, but dagnabbit, she was gonna try. I ordered the bianci flatbread, and my friend ordered the BBQ pizza. The food was excellent, the flatbread was heavy on Gorgonzola and truffle, which was fine with me! I tried the pizza and was awestruck by how light and squishy the crust was. Squishy with the perfect amount of crunch. I have to say that the service improved as we stayed longer. I will definitely be back.

Had dinner here last night. Fabulous server provided excellent service throughout the entire dining experience.  So expensive for what you get. My husband had a pizza - good (thin) crust and okay toppings. My son had the kids pepperoni pizza - standard stuff.  I ordered the Thai pasta with chicken. For $13 it better be a dang good pasta dish. Hardly 3 bites of chicken in the entire dish. Noodles were barely warm - and were cold halfway through finishing the dish. Not spicy enough my taste - but probably fine for a mass service restaurant.  Looked at the dessert menu but the prices were outrageous. $7 for a slice of cake - plus another $1.50 for a scoop of ice cream. Too many other dessert options nearby.  Overall it was not a bad experience. But $50 for two adults and a child with no appetizer, dessert or alcohol was just too much. If food was outstanding or price was lower I would give more stars.

I'd been here once way back in high school, but didn't remember what it was like.  I visited again last week with the same people I'd been with when I went in high school - apparently they go all the time. Overall I wasn't super impressed.  Our waitress was rather snooty and forgetful (we had to ask her twice to bring us some bread) and they were out of gorganzola cheese (how is that possible?), thus making it impossible for my friends to get their regular pizza. My Wild Mushroom pizza was pretty good, though they were not very generous with the sauce.  It made for some tasty leftovers though and I was generally satisfied with my order. The prices seem sort of insane to me, especially for pizza and pasta served from a location in a mall. The salads look pretty good, so I would likely come here again...but it definitely wouldn't be my first choice.

California Pizza Kitchen does a pretty good job with their pizza (fortunately since that's part of their name) and is better than many of the pizza chains around. This CPK is located at the margin of Northgate mall and thus has abundant, but annoying, parking. The interior is minimalistic, but the booths are comfortable and a few TVs at the bar offer the promise of distraction. As an appetizer, we chose the chips and guacamole dip. They have an interesting concoction by using corn in their dip. Surprisingly, this works fairly well with the chips and was a pleasant discovery.  For the main course, I went with the Buffalo chicken. This was well done with just enough spice to be entertaining compounded by celery and ranch dressing.  Service was also prompt with frequent water and coffee refills. Overall it makes a pretty good choice for a quick meal around the mall.

Sometimes you just need the salty cheesy carb-bomb that is the thai pizza at California Pizza Kitchen, or as my family inexplicably calls it "California Pizza Chicken." While their frozen sicilian pizza is in my opinion the only frozen pizza worth buying, the frozen version of their thai pizza is just gross in comparison to the one you get in the restaurant. I've never had a problem with the service at the Northgate location but then again it's a CPK it's not like I'm expecting the world. :) The waiter was friendly and personable, though I did have on nit to pick. My fiancee ordered the wedge salad, I ordered the half roasted vegetable salad and we ordered the Thai pizza. For some reason only his salad came before the pizza despite the fact that I was the one who actually put in the pizza order. Fortunately the pizza was screaming hot so I wasn't forced to deciding between hot pizza and my salad. One thing I love about CPK is their salads. They definitely aren't really for those people watching their diets, a full size salad with chicken will usually clock in at about 1000 calories but they are super delicious. I think their salads, and more specifically the avocado, would be the reason that their prices are high for what they offer. In Washington I've only been to the Bellevue, Tukwila, and Northgate locations but they without fail always have perfectly ripe, bright green avocado and it doesn't taste like it was soaked in preservatives or lime. They must throw out 2 avocados for every 1 that they use or else they have some kind of food science sorcery that lets them preserve the avocado without making it taste like they did. If you work near a CPK and don't mind the prices they offer great to-go service. You have the choice to order online or by phone and either walk-in or at some locations they have car-side service where they just bring it out to your car. When I went to pick up my food from the Tukwila location they always offered me a drink while I waited if I showed up before the specified time.

Sad thing is I like the food but after the lousy service tonight I won't be back. 30 - 45 minutes for the kid to get a cup of hot coco and for the wife to get a cafe mocha was insane. Funny how as the manager was talking to us as we were getting up to leave suddenly the drinks pop up. To late jack, Starbucks and a burger from a fast food joint combined was faster. I wish I could say they were slammin busy but alas there were only 8 tables being used a drunk dude at the bar.

I like California Pizza Kitchens food  and very good quality of it. I like their peperoni pizza and pasta alfredo. But the only bad is they are so expensive and that's why I don't dine there that often. They are too much money and outrageous prices too. But very service thoe. Heidi

I love CPK! Things I love: Spinach Artichoke Dip which are served with chips, Garlic Cream Fettucine with Shrimp and Mushrooms, BBQ Chicken Salad, and the Pulled Pork Pizza served with Habanero Sauce. Soooo delicious!! :) I always tend to go to CPK with my girlfriends for lunch because we rarely have to wait to eat and the food is excellent. The reason why I docked one star was because they changed their table bread. It used to be really yummy and now it's just bleh. Other than that, everything is great!

So the first time I ever stepped into a CPK, I always knew they had great pizza. But I'm not such a pizza person. I visited with my friend, since I live in walking distance from the mall, and it wasn't busy at all. We went during the afternoon, and got seated right away. I presented a free small cravings coupon that I obtained through the bite of Seattle. I ordered the hummus plate, and it was real good. The first time I tried the hummus, was at the bite of Seattle. So good job on the marketing there! Then going on to the main event, I always order and swear by this dish: Portobello mushroom ravioli with cream sauce. The serving may not look so big, but I can never finish it. The ravioli is big enough to half it and take bites from there. Service wise, seems like they know their stuff and good customer service. As we were leaving we were handed these special coupons that we had to go back and dine to redeem. Once again good idea! I'm probably going this week or next!

Solid. Decent service.   Food was quick. Pizza was predictably tasty - although, hard to go wrong with pizza... "Special dishes" not as predictable. Peeps, it's called CPK.  Stick to the pizza, and it'll be *** all good ***
Tried their new Dark and Red drink and loved it!!!! Also Amy tried the Appleberry and likes it!!! Good place and great food
A bit drab and dimly lit.  Salad was very good but pizza was heavy.  Disappointing after a great experience in Austin TX CPK.

Good food, they do a great job of making their food flavorful without adding a lot of fat.  However, I feel it is expensive for the portion sizes.  The grilled vegetable salad was delicious but very skimpy on the actual vegetables, and filled out with tons of romaine lettuce.  Asparagus soup was a huge winner, creamy and flavorful.   Server was nice, but he only came by to take orders, drop off food, and then drop off the check.  No offers of a drink refill or asking if we needed anything.

This is my least favorite cpk location.  To start, I had the most boring server in the restaurant. He did not have the personality of other servers in the restaurant which makes interactions quite difficult. He was also a bit slow. When i asked for a refill it took about 3 minutes(it was kind of slow at the time of us sitting down)  The location is very spacious and clean. It has plenty of seating and during lunch time their was no wait which is always great.  The food was great like usual. I always start out with the dumplings that are always mmmmmm mmm good with the Hawaiian pizza. I am a once every 2 month regular at cpk.

I live in California now, but haven't gone to this restaurant in its home state.  I like the food and the salads are huge and amazing.  The pizza choices are so vast I can't decide.  But it is an overpriced chain and not my favorite.

Always friendly staff and very little waiting for a table even when its crowded.  I love the BBQ chicken salad!   And the garlic pasta is worth the trip to the mall to get it.  Besides, you need to do some shopping anyway.

I've been here a few times with friends, and I'm sorry to say that I've never had a great experience here. The service is always terrible (rude, forgetful waiters) and the food is mediocre at best. Save your money and hit up someplace like Zeek's in Greenlake when you're in the mood for pizza.
Not bad. A sit-down pizza restaurant. Sort of like the Denny's of pizza restaurants.

This restaurant had a very unplesant odor that filled the entire place with the exception of the bathrooms. I was a guest in a group of 8, so early departure wasn't possible, but I couldn't wait to escape. In addition, the atmosphere is like a glorified Denny's and the food truly mediocre.

I've always loved CPK, not because I am a Cali girl, but its a nice joint. They do have something for everyone on their menu. Their drinks are nice, I saw the girl who was making them. She was a bit heavy handed at pouring (nice touch)! LOL! You can also get sugar free flavored teas! I have no idea why, but I never have ordered their pizza in house. It has been either take out, or the frozen ones at the store! Hahahah! Ok so today the fiance wanted to treat me out to lunch. We both ordered the BBQ chopped chicken salad. Our favorite. Since I have been cutting out certain things from my diet, I ordered it without the tortilla strips, and no avocado, with balsamic dressing on the side. The waitress was very accommodating, not flinching once.  We also got an order of the Singapore Rolls, (again due to my cutting back). The salad was terrific. We both found that it didn't need the dressing and was good the way it was. Mine came with a lime wedge so I happily squeezed away. Mine came with avocado, but oh well, I love it and thought it was a nice treat. The lunch portion was just about the right size, I ate a bit more than half and boxed the rest. The Singapore Shrimp Rolls were just a glorified Goi Cuon (Vietnamese salad rolls), though the noodles were tossed in a dressing, and it had different veggies. The slaw that came with it was pretty tasty. We liked it ok. Not as good as mine, but it is good to see people's interpretation of things. LOL! My fiance also thoroughly enjoyed his Coconut Mojito. I had a few sips, and like I said it was a nice strong drink. The staff were all friendly and nice. I'd rather go here than Azteca's, Stanford's, and Macaroni Grill. I can't say anything about the Ram, since I have never been. But overall nice experience was had again.

I first had some California Pizza Kitchen pizza on a date--it was a thai barbeque mix, or something of the sort, and it was just plain delicious.  I had never had bbq anything on a pizza before and had some reservations, but the first bite assured me this was going to be a match made in heaven, at least between the pizza and me.

I know chains are the devil in Seattle but I was glad to see a CPK here.  Reminded me of home. Had it delivered so can't speak to the actual restaurant, but the food was delicious.  A little greasier than I remembered, but delicious nonetheless.  Did seem pretty expensive for what I got, though.
their pizza is good. the crust is good i could eat it alone. tostada pizza is my favorite. the pasta dishes are pretty good.

I've been in this location a few times and it's good, but not great.  The food is good and the service is okay.  We just went there with some family and I enjoyed my veggie pizza.  We had to ask for things like more bread, a children's menu, and a few other things, but it was good overall.  It's nothing fancy or different.  I put it on the same caliber as an Applebee's, TGI Friday's, or a Chili's.  I did find out that the bread they used to bring out automatically is now only by request.  I guess they're trying to cut costs, so if you want the bread n' butter you gotta ask.
This place is overpriced. The pizza is good, but the atmosphere is lousy. I would take Pagliacci or Mad Pizza over this stuff anytime. Plus those places are way classier and taste quite a bit better.
Love their salads and pizzas. Unexpected quality for a mall restaurant.

I would give it one star but our kids like it.  I thought the pizza was gnarly (in a gross way) but the salads were fairly tasty.  Overpriced for what it is (chain chain chain).  Our waiter (and the hostess) were totally out of it - dazed and confused.  Don't know what the hype is about.  Won't get me back.
I had a pretty good pizza here, and there was a lot on the menu, but not the best.  I like the diner concept of the pizza place and the staff were friendly.

I ordered by phone to be picked up curbside.  I got their a few minutes early but my pizza was ready.  The service was great.  I got the Sicilian.  It was so delicious!  I highly recommend this restaurant.

In need of some comfort food, we stopped into the CPK at the Northgate Mall. Old standby of Artichoke Dip and chips soothed the soul on a cold, dreary nite. Tried the large BBQ Chicken salad and the thin crust special pizza. All good and happy to get back on the road in the rain. Have not had the pasta's though we keep saying we will..aahh one day.

Good food, friendly service and casual atmosphere. My party and I had the barbeque pizza, which was big enough to split between the two of us...and tasty enough to almost make me wish we didn't. Menu was big and varied. Would definitely visit again to try out some more dishes.

I love that this place is a completely dependable chain.  I love the creative pizzas, and the salads are really yummy.  I almost always share the BBQ chicken chopped salad with someone, and then pick out a delicious pizza.  So many good options!  I pick a different one most every time.  Alcoholic drinks here are nothing special and pretty expensive, but I feel like the food is fairly well priced.  The restaurant itself is light and bright, and I've always had good luck with the service there.  And since this location is attached to a mall, you can do a little mall-walking when you're done to burn off lunch! :)

So many problems experienced with this place, but I like the food for a "to go" alternative. The salads are so good, but consistently have taken home a botched package. Forgotten items, wrong order & the offer of a discount card next time for a one time problem makes up for it, but not for multiple repeat issues. Who wants to complain for every other time a mess up.  This last time I ordered take out & decided to have a margarita while I waited. The worst I have ever had & could not drink even half of it. I told the gal helping me & she just looked stunned. I paid $11 w/tip for a undrinkable margarita served in a 6oz glass where the taste was blended ice & margarita mix....terrible. Never again. I have never written a complaint for a restaurant but I am done with this poorly managed restaurant. Even if the food is done right the pricing for what you get is not.
OMG, Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza.... FAN-freakin-TASTIC! That's all I have to say, it was delicious and it is my new favorite CPK selection!

A favorite staple of mine when I travel into the USA. Great salads, tasty appetizers and great main courses (pasts & pizza). Have noticed the portions getting slightly smaller and prices have gone up slightly over the past two years (tho smaller portions appear to be a good thing given the number of patrons who have been the recipient of such good food, obviously to often). Service is always great and prompt, and staff is very preofessional.

I literally just got off the phone with someone who took my take-out order. He had the personality of a rock. The best part is the automated message before you reach an actual person, which says "your call may be recorded to better serve you". Sorry CPK, so far this system of yours isn't working because I have been better served at McDonalds. YEAH, I said it.

Great spot.  Went here for veterans day for free pizza and drink with family.  Kate, our server, was really nice and took care of us.  Food is great no issues.  Loved the friendly service and their good offer on Veterans Day.  Will come back for sure.

The spaghetti there was greasy, but tasty; however, the portions were fairly small for an $11 spaghetti.   The service was pretty good, despite the fact that we entered the dining area 15 minutes before closing.  To my surprise, the service is pretty slow.   3 star messy food with a 4 star price gives this place 2 stars.

I love the food here.  The kung pao spaghetti is delish.  It's great for the kids.  The customer service at times has been lacking and there have been a couple times the kids food has come out after the adults!!!  This brings down the stars.

I love pizza. With that said, CPK's pizza is good when you can't think of anywhere to go or if you're at the Northgate mall. I've been going to various CPK's for the past two years (at least) and all I can say is that the prices keep increasing as the portions keep decreasing while the service (from the server) worsens with each visit... they used to be so enthusiastic... maybe it's the Seattle weather. The BBQ Chicken Salad is one of my favorites, Oriental Chicken Salad could use more greens and less dressing, Corn Chowder could  be less creamy, Chicken Tequila Pasta is untouchable and I've yet to be extremely disappointed by any of the pizzas I've tried but I've had better... much better.

I will definitely say that the pizza I had was very tasty. Although, it was suppose to be Jamaican Jerk, and it really didn't taste anything like Jerk chicken. But it WAS tasty. A little disappointed from that point of view. The peppers, bacon and cheese complimented the pizza well and I got over it. My girlfriend ordered their ever famous BBQ pizza and I was a fan of it, the sauce was sweet and cheese/onions were very good with this. She also ordered their Appleberry sangria and said that the ratio of liquor/wine was too much on the liquor side and that the drink wasn't tasty.  All in all, we had a mediocre time at this place. To top this, our bill came out to around 47 bucks with tip, and honestly don't think it was worth this price. Our pizzas were good, but not THAT good (*cough* tutta bella) and probably won't be coming here that regularly.

This is not my usual kind of restaurant but i had a gift card so i took the kids out that i nanny for here. I have been before quite a lot, though i just don't like supporting chain restaurants as much which is why i may sound turned off to it but here is what you should know.. The macaroni and cheese, which is on the kids menu but adults can still order it, is amazing. At my old job i worked right across the street from this place and ate it all the time.  Second off- the pizza sauce is something that needs to be mentioned. There is something special about this sauce, it has a sweet taste to it that is just really enjoyable.. I love the pizza because of this. Third- Lastly i had the Sun dried pesto penne which was so so delightful. The noodles were soft and creamy, the tomatoes were flavorful and it was nice and light. The portions are friendly so i had some to take home. The service has also been pretty good too. When i was there with the kids our waiter was very attentive to our needs and lightly joked around with us which i liked. Eh, i know its Seattle and we don't like chain restaurants but this isn't bad for what it is at all!
I am crazy for the chicken piccata and dynamite skrimps! Delish!

After three of us sat down to eat lunch here, we realized we were already having pizza for dinner that same night. Durrrr....so we had to improvise. A bevvy of appetizers it would be! We shared the Spinach Artichoke Dip, the BBQ Chicken salad, and got a cup of soup each.  The dip was served with tortilla chips. In my humble opinion, spinach dip goes better with pita bread or crackers, but it was cheesy and hot and yummy. The salad was a little low on lettuce but pretty good, especially because it had little tortilla strips on top for crunch. (Apparently they like using chips in their dishes!) I had the split pea soup, which was nothing like my Mama's but definitely edible.  Grand total was $40 before tip, which seems a bit much for how little we got. Pizza is a far better way to spend your money here; too bad we didn't think of that before we walked in the place.

What happened to my thank you card? I'll dispense with the criticism first. There is some sort of promotion going on right now at CPKs that involve a thank you card that can only be opened on your next visit (to reveal some variable prize, I presume). We were pleasant. We did not complain, and in fact embarrassingly raved about the salad. But for some reason, Josh, our waiter, thought us unfit for a thank you card, when the booths on either side of us received them. Tsk, tsk, Josh. You should never let a guest feel unequal to other guests.  Now that THAT is out of my system. YUM: any assortment of pizzas (Jamaican Jerk, Thai chicken, Wild Mushroom, many others) BOMB: their salads! I would eat salads ALWAYS if I could make them like this at home (with minimal effort, of course). Highly recommended: Miso Seafood (you can get it down-charged to chicken instead) and Thai Crunch. Why revel in a chain restaurant when there are many wonderful small or local pizza joints, you ask? Well, when I want something filling, and not food coma-inducing, this is the sort of thing I go for (either this or a bun salad at a Vietnamese joint, depending on my mood): consistently non-greasy dough, and a variety of filling and tasty salads.  Plus, they regularly do carry-out, which is great when I am lazy, don't want to indulge in fast food, and forget that I might be in a personal recession.

OK, it's not terrible, but not gourmet.  If you're looking for a cheap decent pizza, find the frozen CPK pizzas in your local grocery store.  They are 95% the same as the ones sold in their restaurants.  The prices are fair, and better than most delivery places, but it's certainly not a unique flavor combination.  Pretty common amongst large franchises.  The service is quick though, and even though we had to wait for a table last time, the line moved quickly.

I've been here a few times and generally find the food and service to be solid.  Unfortunately, I tend to come here with less adventurous eaters and so we wind up going with things like the four cheese and tomato pizza, or the margarita pizza.  Now hear me out - I have no problem with the simpler things in (pizza) life but this place has some seriously interesting options.  Rosemary chicken and potatoes on a pizza? And what about the Mexican-ish one I spotted today?   The prices are reasonable enough for what you get.  Hopefully the next time I make it up to Northgate I go with people who are ready to branch out!
Yummy pizza, moderately priced, fair service and located near the mall. I come here regularly with my wife when we stop by Northgate for something.

Ok, first I have to say that I am not a fan of chain restaurants and even less of a fan of restaurants in malls.  And as far as malls go, Northgate is LOW on my list. That said, CPK is one of our favorites for a casual evening out with our son.  The food is always good, they have lots of booths, and the service is usually great (except that one time...) Definitely recommend it as a solid family restaurant.
I haven't had the pizza - save for the frozen ones - yet. The sangria was very very tasty - and the waldorf salad rocked my socks!

A  Fan of the Asparagus and Spinach Pasta!  What's up with the stacked-up white bread, accompanied by cold pats o butter?!  It looks so unappetizing! I actually have a plastic bag of the slices of bread and butter in my purse, right now!  Yes, I had the pasta for lunch, and then placed a to go order of the morrocan chicken-free salad for dinner(3 pieces of chicken flew into my salad-hummm?).  The 3 bags of bread with their friends, butters were tossed into my bag from under the register(only upon request for to go orders?) to go with the spaghetti bolognese for the bf. 4 stars for the food, 1 star for the sad bread.  I'm undecided on service--stay tuned.

If you think (as I do!) that food has to have soul and heart, I am afraid you are in the wrong place here. This is definitely a big corporation and it feels like that. For how much I try to avoid chains, I always end up in one. Luckily, here we had good food and good service.  John and I came here with our friends Kathy and Heather on a day we were really hungry for pizza but, of course, we had to have something else.  We started with the Original chopped salad and the Sesame ginger chicken dumplings.  Then we had two pizzas: the  Meat cravers and the Buffalo chicken pizza.  Everything was good or very good. I especially enjoyed my meat pizza. Flavors were good and that made me forget the 'impersonal' style of this place. In summary, we would definitely go back for their pizza and salads if we are in Northgate area.
I've been here twice in the past couple years, and I haven't been disappointed. The "Vegetarian with Japanese Eggplant" on honey-wheat dough is a winner.

I was very disappointed in the service I received here at CPK.  I ordered online for a curbside pick up.  My order was for a work function and it needed to be completed in a timely matter.  I received my food order and returned back to work, but by the time I returned to work my order was NOT complete.  Out of the 7 pizzas I ordered 3 were not complete.  I ordered 3 Greek pizzas and all I received was the crust--without the toppings.  The manager called my cell and told me that they forgot to give the pizza toppings.  It took a total of TWO hours to receive my full order (for traveling back and fourth from work to CPK).  All I received as a "sorry" was a piece of cake. This is unacceptable.  The food is of good quality (when the order is completed) but the service was very POOR and because of this experience, I personally will not want to come back nor will my company will not use CPK for anymore of our work functions.

People in the Northwest hate chain restaurants, myself included. We even hate the chains that made it big around here like Starbucks. Even small local chains like Red Robins get our collective hackles up.  I came to CPK with that mind set. I was not going to like it no matter what. Even with that mind set I was pleasantly surprised. The food was good and got to us in a timely manner. Service was very nice and prices were reasonable.

The food is absolutely delicious.  What I have a problem with is the price. With that said, I probably will continue to frequent this place.  I have been here so many times because of how great the food is, never a sad visit, it's always fun times! I gave it a 3 star rating, but I urge everyone to at least try this place a few times.   My 'gf' and I always get the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad.  This Salad is probably the best salad ever... it's about 13$.  We usually pick an appetizer and a pizza to go along with it.  The hummus is pretty good.   The pizza we always get is either the Sicilian or Tandoori Mango Chicken.  Those are the best.  You have the option of getting the pizza on Honey-Wheat Dough and it's really good too.  Each pizza is about 14$ too and they aren't that big...  Not sure how helpful this review is because everyone else thinks the prices are really reasonable.  I guess I'm just being a little tougher because I'm forced to save due to the crappy economy...

I don't have high expecations when it comes to chain restaurants but this one deserves some brownie points. The staff there is very attentive and amusing without being fake or annoying, yet the dishes are packed with flavor. Pizzas and pastas galore! My fave is the pesto chicken pasta, chicken lettuce wraps, and the small bites appetizers (which is a great idea) has this amazing tamale ravioli that is dynamite! I love it when my glass of water is always full and the dishes come out right on time so no complaints and it's always a great place to grab a bite with a friend or two!!

Been here several times over the past 4 years, and it's a decent, albeit pricey choice at Northgate.  I don't frequent it, and would probably choose other places, but it's way better than the "Mexican place next door" or "The outparcel nearby."   Their pizzas are solid, the waitstaff hit or miss (one time my waitress went out to have a smoke right in front of the window in her work outfit and in full view of everyone...ewww).  If you go, try the Miso Salad for a great, low-cal choice!

I've looked at it for 11 years and stepped foot in it for the very first time this last month. It was about 8pm, the place was about 1/3 full. For some reason, staff found it a good time to clean the place. My friends who were dining with me at that time were quite miffed by the fact that they were vaccuuming the carpet down the aisles and spraying Windex on the glass right next to the customer tables. (I was, too, but was thankful enough not to have Windex on my pizza.) Thankfully, our waiter wasn't busy cleaning the restaurant to give us some attention. The selection was pretty good for me, and there were quite a few topping combinations I wanted to try. In the end, we settled for a White Pizza and a Thai Pizza.  Again, fairly decent pizza (Zeke's Thai Pizza is mucho better than this.. but I may be biased towards the first time I've had Thai Pizza) at a high price. I wouldn't mind trying other flavors, though I don't know when I'll have any hankering to come back to the place. The two pizzas were fairly small, and absolutely no problem for 3 people to finish. Then again, it's not like we got anything that was truly meaty.

This place was better than I expected, mostly due to the pizza. I met up with a few friends for dinner here recently, and all three of us were pleasantly surprised. The waiter was friendly and funny, and the pizza, we all agreed, was fantastic. We had originally set out to share slices of our different pizzas amongst each other but my gluttonous desire for the kind I ordered (BBQ chicken with applewood smoked bacon) had me devouring the whole thing without sharing. That's not me, I always share! Also, since when can I eat an entire pizza in one sitting (regardless of its size)? Wow. So I give it four stars. I would give it five if it were a slight bit cheaper, because for a medium-ish smaller size pizza, $13 is a bit much. Guess it is all about quality not quantity, and they do have plenty of quality.

Note to self: next time I go to CPK, stick with the pasta and pizza. I ordered the mahi-mahi and the fish came out dry and overcooked. Oh boy. the side dish spaghettini though was just a wee bit step down from fabulous. Our server is beyond fast, he was so prompt with everything I had half a mind to give him a gold star. As it was, I didn't have a gold star on me (bummer), so we tipped him well instead. Wonderful, wonderful man.

Ok, ok ok!  I get what I deserve.  I KNOW!  However, my brand new boss wanted to have lunch somewhere in this mall and I am NOT going to Panera.  So whatever, I get the half bbq chicken salad which is predictable.  If you ate it in Milwaukee you know what it taste like here.  The bizarre thing, for me a NYer, damn why is my wait staff so talky??  I don't care what is your favorite thing on the menu, or how slow it is, or what bizarre dream you had last night - can you just go get my salad?  Thanks.
I like CPK. I don't love it.  But I do really like the miso chicken salad. So good for a quick satisfying lunch.

I love thin crust pizza, and last night I really wanted some but I didn't want to venture out of Northgate so I went to CPK and they have never let me down. My husband and I had our 2 1/2 year old nephew who will forever go through his terrible 2's, and while he did good overall, I cannot say that he didn't get a little bit rambunctious towards the end of the meal, and my guess is the staff must be used to it or are absolutely great at ignoring little kids, but they were great. They even gave him an apple juice refill before we left. Great place to bring kids and good food as always.

Yes, this is a chain and really, everything about CPK (Corporate Pizza Kitchen, as I lovingly refer to it), sucks...with one exception; the pizza is good.  Forget what you know about New York and Chicago style pizza.  California style pizza is now officially its own genre, and these people invented it and still do it better than anyone.  The pear-gorgonzola pizza is awesome, so is the Thai chicken.  The only catch is that you have to go to the mall and dine among yuppies, teenyboppers and crying babies to get it.  Sigh.

The pizzas here are really good.  From the fresh hand spun crust to the sauce including the very kinds of cheese they used.  I sad the steak Carne Asada and it was heavenly.  My friend's BBQ chicken pizza was so good that she had refused to share.  The other friend had the Southwest mix pizza which I didn't see on the menu but it was good but a little damp in the bottom crust because it was so juicy. It wasn't really that busy or over crowded and the noise level was definitely low.  Good service.  The pizzas were kind of pricey for $15+ per personal pizza but definitely a treat!
you know, its just cpk.  but i like cpk, so there.  besides, its a nice place to hide away from the rest of the northgate mall

I'm picky about pizza and I like theirs, especially the sauce and the crust. While I prefer authentic thinner crusts, this doesn't taste like a doughy pre-frozen chain store crust at all, and the sauce doesn't approach bitter or overly tomato pastey. I hate malls, but if I'm in Northgate and hankering for pizza I'll go here.
Went there for dinner with couple folks and was decent.  place was happening.  lots for folks.  food was decent also.

Very disappointed with my experience at this location and I haven't been here long enough to get my food? I came in to place a to-go order (the greeter is exceedingly pleasant and helpful- young, brunette- I should ask for her name), the woman who takes the orders (Michaella?) is apparently too busy being idle to acknowledge or assist me in any way. She took so long that I asked the TWO other employees at the bar for help (crickets) because no one speaks except the greeter? So, to my rescue, the exceedingly polite young greeter placed my order. I hesitate to give one star, but the nice receptionist prevented me from leaving all together. If ordering here wasn't a necessity, I would leave. I will NEVER return. I won't make assumptions as to why I'm being ignored, however, no one else here seems to be suffering from a lack of polite/quick service. Besides, this place is EMPTY at lunch time

Wow!  What a strange and horrible experience! I've been a long-time CPK fan -- particularly when traveling for business, when you want to go somewhere that is going to have quickly served at least pretty good food that isn't going to get you a call from the accountant after you submit your expense report.  CPK has been that place for me (kudos to the Oak Brook, Illinois location, where I've spent many a dinner after a day at a local client site). So, I know what to expect, as do my wife and kids.  But, noooooo.  Not this time.  While the food was most definitely sub-par (the mac and cheese, which is usually good, was flavorless and the salmon salad was pretty much inedible), we going to talk about something else today.  What might that be?  Why, our waiter, of course. In short, I'm really not even sure how to explain what went wrong.  I actually found myself mentally trying to put the story together prior to asking for the manager to come by, and I found that nothing I could say would really do justice to the situation. He took our drink order.  No drinks appeared.  After quite a while, we nicely asked for our drinks.  He asked what we ordered.  Told him again.  No drinks.  But he spent an inordinate amount of time at the terminal, flipping through his pad and punching things into the computer. He brings bread to the table, which is immediately consumed by hungry family. Still no drinks. Finally came by to take our food order.  That took a while. Goes directly to another table to take their order, rather than punching our order into the computer.  He's there for a loooong time. One drink appears! We ask for the rest of the drinks.  He asks what we ordered. We ask for more bread. YAY!  The kids' meals appear!  Nope.  They're kids meals, but not for our kids.  He takes them away and sort of starts offering them to the occupants of his various tables.  They appeared to eventually find a home in front of some children a few tables away. Still no food.  And one drink.  We ask for drinks again.  Waiter asks what kind of tea my wife had ordered, which we took as a good sign that he at least remembered she ordered tea. Drinks appear! We see waiter sort of aimless walking around with a plate of bread.  Eventually he diverts to our table.  Yes!  Bread!  Three pieces for four people. Waited a while longer, and the food appears.  See above note about quality of the food). I think we must have had "a look" on our faces, because one of the other waitstaff was walking by and stopped.  She wanted to know if everything was OK.  No, she wasn't the manager.  I could only incoherently mumble something about "bad" due to no clear manner of explaining the dystopian dining situation in which we'd found ourselves. We ate what we could that was sort of edible.  Shared our plates to ensure that nobody left too hungry -- you know, like a pack of leopards around a fallen gazelle.  Somebody else was clearing our table, when our waiter appears. . . with a caesar salad.  No, we didn't order it.  He looks confused.  Or crestfallen.  Or crestfused.  Whatever.  We had't ordered it. He finally asks if we want refills on our drinks. The manager comped the entire meal.  We didn't even have to ask her to do so or ask her to come to the table.  At some point she just figured out what was going on.  Sort of like when you pass an accident and see everybody standing by their cars on the side of the highway.  I think that's pretty much what she saw going on at our table. We're probably not going to be back for a while.

How I heard of this place: I fail to recall how, or when I first heard of CPK, but this was my first time at the Northgate establishment, thanks to Veteran's Day deals offered for a good friend and an invitation extended to us. Type of cuisine: "hand-tossed artisan pizzas, classic, unique pastas and salads, fresh, seasonally inspired ingredients, hand shaken cocktails, premium wines and craft beers." Ambiance: Sparse, dimly lit and clean, the streamlined space is perfect for a casual date, a spontaneous family dinner, and a casual go-to for an impromptu dinner out while shopping. What I ordered: The ending to our Veteran's Day of eating out, I opted for a simple Asparagus and Arugula Salad ($5.95) tossed in housemate lemon vinaigrette with sun-dried tomatoes, toasted almonds and shaved parmesan. Garlic Cream Fettuccine and Chicken (free for Veteran's), "the ultimate roasted garlic Parmesan cream sauce" for my husband, and The Original BBQ Chicken (free for Veteran's), "legendary BBQ sauce, smoked gouda, red onions and cilantro" for our friend. What I loved: The lemony tartness paired with the salty goodness of the Parmesan in the Asparagus +Arugula Salad. Why I loved it: A variety of Italian-inspired meals for everyone.   Cost: Average to high ($12-$20 per main entrée)

Service is never a disappointment here. It brings home to Washington. Everything on the menu is the same. You can never go wrong with the BBQ chicken pizza. I love the Italian chopped salad! They offer curbside service, so, so if I'm in the area, I often find myself picking one or the other to go. Quick, convenient and comforting.

My coworkers and I ordered some pizzas online for me to pick up and bring back for lunch. I had originally checked curb side pick up but since there was a delivery truck in the area I decided to go inside. The hostess led me to the take out counter where I waited for a few minutes before anyone helped me. I finally received the pizzas and returned to work where we noticed it didn't look as if there was any cheese on them. I called to ask about it and whoever I spoke to, I believe it was the manager, basically told me he had seen the pizzas go out and they did in fact have cheese. There was no apology or offer to make it better. I was told "that's just the way it is". Considering we spent about $70 on these pizzas I guess I expected better service and better pizza.

My bf and I came here for lunch today. I ordered the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine while he had the Chicken Club with baked potato soup. We shared a sangria flight special they had.  There were a few things wrong with our visit. Where to start... We wanted to sit outside and asked if they would turn on the outdoor heater. It was a little brisk out but still a beautiful day. One waiter said sure but they only turn them on in the evenings so she'd have to get someone to turn it on. Once we were seated, another waiter said they aren't working so great right now, so they won't turn it on. Okay... I waited 15 minutes for the bread basket, and when I realized after 3 times the waitress stopped by that it wasn't coming, I asked if they still offer it. She said yes and brought it out a few minutes later. My pasta dish was ok, not great but not bad. I'd give that 3 stars.  The sangria flight was interesting to try, although nothing I would order again. His soup was ok, a little salty and bland though. The sandwich was good, but about 3 bites in he felt a sharp piece of plastic in it. We let the waiter know and she had the sandwich remade, but not to our specifications to accommodate food allergies.  When we asked for the check, she happily told us she didn't charge us for the second sandwich/soup combo - the one we had to send back because they made it wrong. But she still charged us for the first one - the one that we sent back because it had bits of plastic in it. Why would we pay for either of them?? We asked her to please remove the charge for the sandwich, not the soup which he ate, and explained why. She did that, but we're baffled as to why we had to ask. I would give 2 stars for quality of food. And one star for customer service.

Bad bad experience there today..the last time my server suggested the lettuce wrap and to have the shrimp/chicken separated in two separate bowls. It was delish and tried to order it today. First the server said the kitchen couldn't do it, the manager came over and said their would be "too many vegetables in one bowl", "we just don't do that", "what was your servers name"... ARE YOU KIDDING ME???  Well. Won't go back. What idiots.

For what it is (annoying californicated mall chain store) it's pretty good.  They make a salad my wife likes (BBQ chicken) and I find their fish tacos and chicken chimichuri tolerable. They have a rewards program that tosses us a discount now and again. There are worse things.  This particular location has an issue with one or more of their floor drains. When they go without being cleaned and sanitized for a while, they give off a particular odor, something between rotting garbage and somebody else's feet. Please just get it done guys. A couple buckets of hot sanitizer and a brush will have it done in ten minutes. Service is usually ok, sometimes better than ok. I usually get better service at the bar, which has the additional benefit of getting you out of range of the Chuckie Cheese refugees screaming and messing the booths in other parts of the restaurant. The Southcenter location is notably better.

I will never come here again. Jerby was the WORST server I have ever had. There were hardly any other people there and she came to our table twice. She took our order and checked on us once.  My husband and I waited and waited for water. When we finally received our pizzas, I was so sad to see that my pizza was cold and under cooked. I was so hungry by the time I received my food that I tried to just eat it. When Jerby came to FINALLY  check on us we asked her for some pepper flakes, a box and our check. she NEVER came back. Instead she was texting on her phone and laughing and ignoring us. She was literally standing by the computer screen texting for 20mins. Unbelievable. I mean, if you're going to text and ignore customers, at least go in the kitchen to do it. We had to ask the hostess to help us since Jerby never came back. The hostess was friendly and prompt and asked Jerby for our check, when we got our check she had charged us for an extra pizza. We asked to have it corrected and even then she took off the cheaper pizza, (which was mine) and left the more expensive pizza, (not ours) on our bill. At this point my husband and I were just so irritated we just paid and left. This was by far the WORST experience in customer service I have EVER received.

This is how my meal usually goes here:   Starter: corn guacamole and chips.  Entree: caramelized peach salad.  Dessert: salted caramel pudding.   Perhaps I should try a GF pizza, since they offer my favorite kind (BBQ chicken).  Or order a pasta dish for my husband (the four cheese ravioli and jambalaya fettuccine taunt me) and have a bite (or three).  Or ask if they could make their carnitas tacos with corn tortillas, so I could indulge in those instead?  While I am tempted, I usually stick to my regular appetizer, salad, pudding combo.  It always satisfies.   You're a charmer, CPK.

This restaurant serves very hearty and rich foods. Every bite is dripping with some butter or cheese. Basically, not a place to go if one is being mindful of some sort of body transforming New Year's resolution. However, with that being said, this review is for a "Rich and Hearty Pizza" restaurant. I had ordered the Rib Eye steak and the jambalaya. This place is not a great place to get a good steak, but they'll charge steak house rates. (Price of the steak was $27.99) The meat was tough and lacked flavor. I ordered the steak done medium well and there was "rare" blood pooling on the curls of the steak. I suppose the brick of cheese set on top of the steak was intended to mask the low quality of the cut, but it really didn't help. I was basically eating cheesy rib eye steak. Now onto the Jambalaya, the dish wasn't too bad. Every bite was an explosion of flavor down down to the last bit. Some may enjoy this sort of flavoring, but I just felt it was over powering the good ingredients. The Jambalaya had shrimp, crawfish, sausage, and a tasty pasta. I couldn't finish the dish, but the first few bites were very delicious. I don't want to knock this restaurant due to it not appealing to my palette, but just know that this place serves very rich and hearty foods.

I sat at the bar after a long day and was immediately greeted with a smile and how was I. The bartender, Kriss,  seemed really busy but still took the time to explain a few things on the menu and understand what I wanted for my dinner. Thanks to him I will be returning. The food was a flat bread and it was really good. It was fast and all the staff seemed busy but not stressed.

Sometimes, you just need a chain restaurant on a rainy weekend when you're stuck at a mall. CPK fits the bill for me, because I love their barbeque chicken salad and Margherita pizza. We were seated in a nice roomy booth that was very comfortable for our family of five. It took a while for our waiter to make his way over to us, but he made up for the initial delay with friendly service and attention throughout our meal. So, what can I say... if you've been to CPK, then you know their food is solid. The kids enjoyed their fusilli with cream sauce, barbeque chicken pizza and pepperoni pizza (picky eater child, of course). I convinced my husband to share the chopped barbeque chicken salad and Margherita pizza - seriously, I love that thin and chewy crust! I was lucky he obliged, since he sacrificed his usual Kung Pao spaghetti to share my favorites with me.

I will start by saying that I normally enjoy the CPK fare, but today was not their crowning day. The manager was their saving grace. I had to ask questions multiple times and we got perrier instead of sprite. :(.  Next  time CPK!

Had dinner on Friday night. My second time there. It was obviously popular, judging from how crowded the place was. The works pizza and jalapeno carnitas pizza were great. I loved the jalapeno carnitas one a tad bit more. It came with a little side of sauce. The pizza itself wasn't spicy, BUT I can eat really spicy food, so it may be spicy to some of you who are reading this. The sauce had this kick, not right when you eat it, but after a short while. I thought it was great.  However, I do feel that $13 for a 10-inch pizza is a little much. This is a franchised restaurant after all, and I do feel that I can get better quality pizzas for more money at Italian restaurants.

I hadn't been here in a few years and thought I'd try it again. Wrong decision. Service was fine but all the great menu items I loved are gone. Food was mediocre at best. I ordered a salad and when I asked for no basil I was told it all comes pre-packaged and pre-shredded. Say what? I avoid packaged greens in the grocery store as they are so often the subject of a recall. So I certainly am not going to a restaurant that uses them. I should have got a clue when at the peak of the lunch hour there were very few diners in the place. Needless to say I won't be going back.
