Prices are way too hight but the chx avocado egg rolls are amazing and the squash soup was good. First time visiting, probably wont go back since the menu is pretty much the same as Chillis but with pizza thrown on there.

Maybe I don't go to CPK enough but we were desperate for a quick food option last night so I have it a try.  First, I was shocked at the price of a personal pizza so I decided to get the turkey sandwich instead. Big mistake!  They brought out a cold sandwich on cold dry bread. (California club that says nothing about being cold in the menu). After coughing down the first half I took the rest home to see if I could improve it. Put the bread in the toaster and the turkey in the microwave for a couple of minutes. Major improvement!  Nice moist sandwich that had good flavor.  The big question now is, why doesn't CPK do this as well?  Maybe the bread is usually fresher but if it were me, I would always toast the bread to be sure.

My sister won a gift certificate for a free entree and free soft drink through her employer (she was the employee of the month in June). As far as a chain restaurant goes, I feel California Pizza Kitchen is pretty good. Decor / Location 4 Stars The restaurant is located in north end of Northgate Mall by the entrance. Extra stars to the parking. The restaurant was clean, wide, and bright. Comparing with other chain restaurants, CPK seems pretty well maintained. Service 4 Stars Good Service. The server explained the menu because it was the first day they launched new food on the menu. She introduced us a shrimp apertizer and assisted us with the decision of our pizza order. She was very friendly and resourceful. Food 4 Stars My sister had their lemonade. According to her, it was ok! We had Bang Bang Shrimp for appetizer. According to the server, it's one of the most dishes. However, we were not impressed. We felt that we've had better shrimp dishes. We also had hummus. I felt that the hummus was a little too watery for me. Both my sister and I enjoyed the pesto pasta and BBQ chicken pizza. I thought the BBQ chicken pizza with smoky bacon was a good touch. It's a good place for friends and family to hang out. I'd come back again with friends and family for sure.

After working a lot of overtime, the weekend ended on a high note with dinner at the California Pizza Kitchen. I know a lot of people roll their eyes at the thought of a chain restaurant so eff you! It was delicious and I would totally do it again! I tried the pepperoni pizza on honey wheat crust and a waldorf salad, both were excellent choices. Awhile back, I have also tried the spaghetti bolognese and caesar salad, which I am also a fan of.  Yes, I like the California Pizza Kitchen and it is a good thing that it is close to me. It is just a shame that I couldn't think of anything better to say about this place. Zipzap Zubidy Bop!

The food was the same as other CPK locations, but the service was great. The bartender was attentive and polite and made sure we enjoyed our dining experience even though it was a busy day. The food arrived in a timely manner.
The food is okay, but just okay. The prices are too high for what you get.  Not terrible, but nothing special either.

CPK is your run-of-the-mill mall restaurant.  You can expect to pay a bit too much, get a bit less than what's promised, and have a crafted script spewed at you by waiters at specific time increments throughout your meal.  This is a systematized business designed to give you a consistent experience no matter where you are, who is working that night, or what your responses to interactions with employees are.  Everything is measured, analyzed, and built to appeal to the most average Joe.

My family came here for my birthday and our waiter was Mike, who is a waiter we've had a few times! Every time he is our server it is a phenomenal experience! He is super funny and incredibly on top of things. You were barely taking the last few drinks of your soda before there was a brand new one in front of you! He took all of our orders by memory and everything was spot on. He truly made our experience a great one, we will definitely be back and will ask for him every time!

I've been here a couple different times and three stars is consistent for all my visits.  The food is ok but nothing special.  The service is ok, but nothing special.  Yesterday was there for lunch with a friend and our waiter was really not very good and screwed up my order.  Also, he was very sweaty and that just didn't add to the experience.
Your regular place but with good service and a nice menu selection. We ordered pizza and it was good enough for two. Good before movie dinner place-more like an upscale Dennys. Not bad overall.

went there again last week with my friend. I order kungpao spaghetti and my friend had some wine. I waited for a long time for my food, our server keep telling us that the food will be out soon, 10 mins and 2 glasses of wine later, our server came and apologized, apparently his ticket never get through the kitchen, he explain it's probably coz today is his last day working there. He offer us appz or dessert on the house, we opt for dessert. My spaghetti came 10 mins later. When the bill came, they took care of the food and charge only the wine. I was pleasantly surprised by the customer service level they provide in this place. Of course we tip generously, it's not the server fault after all.

Met a friend for lunch here over the weekend.  It'd been over 9 years since I last ate at a CPK but when she gave out suggestions for lunch CPK sounded like a good idea to me.  Due to Midas running late I too was running late for my lunch date but apparently that was OK because there was a wait for the table.  Once I finally arrived we still have another 5 to 10 minute wait which to me was ridiculous for a mall eatery but anyways. We are taken to our table and not even seated yet when our servers pops over and asks if we'd like anything to drink, I'm caught a little off guard, I'd like to take my coat off first and sit down before I'm asked such a tough question as what would you like to drink.  We send her off to find water for us and finally sit down. The menu pretty much looks the same as it did 9 years ago with a few changes.  Since my morning was stressful I decided a cocktail was in order, I went with a raspberry mojito.  It took forever to arrive and I kind of wish it didn't it was more like a raspberry sugar water with mint in it no bueno. Now on to the food.  We started with the Tuscan hummus which was actually rather tasty.  They make theirs with white beans and it had a nice hint of garlic and lemon nothing was too over powering and the warm pizza pita bread they served with it was yummy, however I could have done with out the fresh tomatoes served on top they were a bit to watery for me. I decided on a half Chinese chicken salad and it was drenched in dressing and not in a good way either.  The lettuce, carrots and cilantro that weren't drenched did seem to be pretty fresh and tasty.  If I ever order it again I'd over dressing on the side, I did enjoy the dressing but sometimes too much of a good thing is bad.

The food at CPK is your average pizza and pasta food, but where CPK rocks is in the variety and massive choices on the menu. You can switch it up and order the honey wheat crust, thin crust, etc and it makes for a nice change from the same old thing. Their pastas and salads are unreal and HUGE here also. Dishes are creative and yet you can find the solid staples as well. Pricey for a chain, but the service here is good and the atmoshere is comfortable.

I wish they all could be California Pizza Kitchens: Of all the pizza places around here, only two are outstanding to this 47 year old, Seattle-born, Yelp-talkin-guy. Olympia Pizza and Spaghetti house on Queen Anne Hill and my #1 favorite, CPK at Northgate. Why CPK? See below: 1. Fast and comfortable seating , even on a busy night. 2. Fast, efficient and friendly wait staff 3. A wide variety of outstanding gourmet pizzas. If you're a real carnivore, you should definitely try The Sicilian with its marinara sauce, sweet Italian sausage, spicy Capicola ham, salami, fontina, mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses. Topped with oregano and basil. That was one of my favorites before I gave up pork and beef. I still love and eat the Pear & Gorgonzola pizza with its caramelized pears, Gorgonzola, Fontina, and Mozzarella cheeses, caramelized onions, chopped hazelnuts and served with field greens tossed in herb ranch dressing. Have Mercy, CPK! 4. CPK also serves soda pop as well as beer and pretty decent drinks.   We've been there at least ten times (day or night) so far and our experience  has always been great across the board. I will continue  going to CPK.

Look, here's the thing-the pizza is good, if a little bit odd and/or bizarre at times (ie the duck pizza, weird but good).  This is such a California thing to do, (believe me, I lived in the bay area) but honestly, you really can put just about anything on a pizza and call it "good".  Now the unfortunate part...the service.  Our server had a 3 table section and still couldn't manage to even come over once to check on us, and our pizza took like, 3 milleniums to come out. I almost ate the table while I waited and I had to ask for every refill and the complimentary bread.

Today I went to CPK for lunch for the first time in years. The restaurant used to be a standard dining location for me when I was living in L.A., especially since several of my friends worked there at the time. Being that it had been a while, I decided to order my old standard. My friends and I shared the spinach dip as an appetizer and I had the chicken Caesar focaccia sandwich with tortilla soup. The food was more or less as I remember it. The spinach dip is gooey, rather than chunky, which makes it easier for dipping. Since going to CPK last, I have become accustomed to a homemade spinach artichoke dip that has much more substance to it. Still, the CPK variety is tasty, though we ran out of dip before we ran out of chips, which is kind of annoying. The sandwich didn't seem to be as Caesar-y as it used to be. In fact, it seemed more like a standard chicken sandwich with romaine lettuce. If I order something called a chicken Caesar sandwich, I would hope for a little more dressing, anchovies or a knife in the back or something. The tortilla soup also seems to have evolved. In my opinion, it now contains entirely too much corn. A little bit is okay, but this was like corn chowder. I dislike corn when it's not on the cob. It especially bothers me in soup for the same reason the tapioca balls in bubble tea bug me. Simply put, it makes me feel like I am eating boogers or an equally revolting, chewy substance of approximately nostril size. The soup was tasty apart from the corn and being at CPK brought back memories of college. The price may have gone up a couple bucks since my last visit, but not really enough for me to notice.

My real rating is 3.5 stars. CPK is consistent and I've never had a bad meal. Unfortunately, their service is consistent too--consistently average. I'm not sure if it's a bad work environment, but I've been there many times (10 or more) and both the servers and the hosts always seem preoccupied and just a little grumpy about being at work. The food is good, so if you're looking to just eat and not necessarily have a pleasant experience, then CPK will fit the bill. I agree with some of the other reviews that it's a little pricey for what you get--but the wide variety of pizza choices is nice, as well as pasta dishes and salads.
This place is waaaaay more than 3 stars. I used to work in the area and definitely took this place for granted when I did. Love this place!
i can always count on their pizza and salad.  the service is good and food comes out pretty fast.
A little pricier than it was worth, but the waiter was nice despite appearing completely terrified of making a mistake.  Also seemed a bit rushed to turn over tables.

A very solid 3. Had dinner here tonight after a mall shopping spree (Macy's is having a big sale on cute clothes). Neither of us was super hungry, but we were celebrating Friday and Chris' purchase of an IPhone (2 weeks of waiting wore him down).  Like Mitzie, I ordered the Raspberry Mojito (I swear I hadn't read her review yet), and I thought it was not-so sucky. The first one kinda kicked me on my ass but then again I hadn't eaten since lunch.  I ordered the half cobb with Fat-free Vinaigrette on the side. Chris had the Thai Fettucine. My salad was good, though I thought the beets were a little overwhelming (and I like beets). We both thought Chris' pasta was good, slightly spicy, and the fettucine was cooked perfectly. Chris had a Cabernet and our total bill was $45 something (oh yeah, I had another raspberry mojito - HELLO, it's Friday!). I wish we went there more often because the food is solid. Next time we'll probably grab a pizza. I LOVE their honey wheat crust!
Very generic pizza and appetizers. The service was great though. The waiter was on top of her game....so generic there isn't a whole lot I can say to be specific.

I'm very impressed.  It's been quite awhile since I've been to a restaurant where the entire staff actually cares about being there and as importantly, cares that the customer is there.  Gavin was our waiter and he was excellent.  His appearance was professional, had a genuine smile, and knew his menu.  He was without a doubt a 10.  My friend arrived first and she was greeted promptly and then I arrived and was also greeted within a couple of minutes.  He wasn't pushy and checked on us at perfect times throughout our meal.  The manager, don't know her name, blond and very personable, was on the floor and really cared about the customers needs.   The staff seemed to be very cohesive.  As for the food, we split a bbq chicken salad and Gavin split it without us even having to ask.  It was decicious and was served on well-chilled plates..so delicious.  We also shared a pizza, which was very tasty, it was a new one, can't remember the name, but could have used more cheese for my taste.  I liked their wine by the glass selection.  Not the ususal boring Kendall Jackson and Chateau Ste Michelle.  Ordered key lime pie for dessert, which was very good and a fresh cup of coffee.  This place is in a Mall and so I wasn't expecting much.  They have their act together. Final note:  We arrived in the late afternoon and stayed for a few hours, talking business.  We were not once rushed.  We will be back! THANK YOU!
